author: {'steamid': '76561198070813893', 'num_games_owned': 1261, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1008, 'last_played': 1625964348}
review:
На самом деле очень противоречивая игра.

Болячки Dishonored: мы дадим тебе ворох умений для интересного взаимодействия с врагами и игровым миром, в том числе с летальным исходом, но штраф за убийства и обнаружения. Даже не штраф, а меньшее количество очков для прокачки по итогу, если проходить исключительно по стелсу.

Сам стелс весьма примитивен и главный герой, несмотря на свои магические способности, не в состоянии хотя бы вырубить противника скрытно, если под рукой не будет какого-нибудь предмета, которым можно швырнуть. А такие предметы весьма редкие и далеко не на каждом уровне находятся. Из интересного и необычного только то, что врага можно напугать и ввести в состояние паники. Испуг появляется когда полностью вырубить освещение в том месте, где ходит враг(например, отключить освещение в конате и погасить весь огонь, в том числе факелы) или оставить труп другого врага на видном месте(как мне показалось, при каких-то еще дополнительных условиях). А проявляется испуг в том, что при следующей встрече с вами враг не побежит бить вас, а в панике убежит. Паническое состояние вызывается вышеперечисленным способом, а там же при пожаре, заточении в лёд, заточении в лозы и подобные вещи, так же панику могут вызывать некоторые эффекты метеоритных осколков(особенно повеселил эффект  паники врага, когда при нём вылазишь из гроба).

Система магии интересная, но не всегда удобная. Поглощаем источник нужной нам стихии(например, если был огонь костра, то после поглощения костёр больше не горит) и используем по своему усмотрению. И здесь же кроется самый главный минус: интересно становится играть только ближе к концу, а еще лучше в НГ+, где уже позволят со своими скиллами идти и возится как в песочнице. А до этого - пока не пройдёшь главу - стихию не получишь, не то что воспользоваться новыми скиллами. Кстати говоря, здесь чисто физически невозможно открыть(не прокачать на максимум, а именно открыть возможность использования) все навыки и умения(которых, на самом деле, можно пересчитать по пальцам). Возможно, в этом и кроется плохая статистика прохождений. Например, достижение о первом прохождении игры, на момент написания обзора, имеют всего лишь 5,2% игроков, запускавшие игру. Что довольно-таки малое значение, даже не принимая во внимание в тот факт, что игра не длинная.

Уровни в этой игре довольно-таки маленькие. Иногда прямо крайне маленькие. Уровни, которые можно назвать полноценными - пара штук и то в самом конце(городские локации).

Игра по итогу мне всё же понравилась, но рекомендовать всем и каждому я бы не стал. Хорошо, что хоть разработчик дорбросовестный и добавил демку на страницу игры, так что каждый человек может попробовать демку и решить для себя сам, понравится ли геймплей или нет.

А еще по какой-то странной причине в рядах врагов нет мужчин совсем. То ли это какой-то радикальное феминистичесткое движение с садисткими наклонностями, либо еще что.. Ведь мы и практически все мирные жители, которых мы спасаем из плена - мужчины. Просто интересный факт.

А еще с котом  всего одна миссия(окей, две, только в одной мы сами бегаем за кота, а в другой кот является нашим компаньоном). А мне понравилось натравлять свою ручную рысь на злых женщин. И кидать в них из кустов кота и смотреть на панику.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092321352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1625340841}
review:
序盤は直接敵を追い払う手段に乏しく、地下水路を潜ってかわしたり草むらから飛び出して驚かせたりしながら進んでいくステルスアクション。
ただし、他のレビューでも指摘されているようにステルス≠暗殺である。
能力の強化が進むと直接足止めできるようになるが、特定の地形を利用する以外でサクッと殺す手段は存在しない。
敵の間近までこっそり近づいても暗殺できないステルスゲームはホラー以外で初めて見たかもしれない。

セール時は千円以下まで下がるので少なくとも価格分は楽しめると思うが、気になる点もある。
・ジャンプ力が横スクロールアクションとしては低く、高所からの落下耐性も低いので動き回る爽快感はない。
・火を付けない方が有利になる場面が多い？
・敵味方とも経路探索の挙動が怪しく、不殺や全員救出を狙っているときに針に刺さったり溺れたり敵の前に飛び出したりする。

author: {'steamid': '76561197983324441', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1625301064}
review:
I tossed an earth ball off a ledge, creating a patch of grass where I could land safely and silently behind a guard.  Then I picked it back up and threw it at him to incapacitate him with vines.  That's when I knew that, at heart, this is a Thief game.

I mean, okay, it's a side scroller, and it's purely level-based (where you can replay levels to complete bonus objectives to upgrade stuff).  But it's 90% a stealth game, and every level's bonus objectives include "don't kill anyone" and "don't get spotted".  At the same time, creativity rewards you with a bajillion ways through every level.  It's not an easy game, but somehow it's also a power fantasy.  If you like the genre, I'd recommend it full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110052635', 'num_games_owned': 1698, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1625089922}
review:
[b]Wildfire[/b] es un juego de sigilo y plataformas, en el que no se empuña ningún arma más que una especie de magia puramente utilitaria. Con ella, deberás de salvar a los pueblerinos cautivos por la Archiduquesa a través de diversos escenarios parcialmente destruibles, y volver a tu hogar.

A lo largo del gameplay rige el concepto de la manipulación de elementos para alterar el entorno y poder conseguir nuestros objetivos a través del sigilo y el engaño. En concreto son tres los elementos que podemos utilizar: fuego, tierra y agua. Cada uno tiene sus funciones específicas, sin embargo, ninguno de ellos puede dañar directamente a los enemigos, aunque si podemos generar situaciones que lo hagan. Cada escenario tiene un objetivo principal necesario para avanzar en la historia y otros objetivos secundarios que nos proporcionan puntos para repartir en habilidades no elementales. Por otro lado, hay estatuas que de arrojarle el elemento deseado, nos otorga un punto a dicho elemento y con toda esta sumatoria generar nuestra humilde build. El personaje responde muy bien a los controles y el nivel de diversión es grande dado que cada escenario se puede llegar al objetivo final de múltiples maneras. La posibilidad de jugar la campaña entera en cooperativo [u]local[/u] no es un detalle menor. Eventualmente, y ya en la recta final, el juego deja de sorprender: el esquema se repite.

La historia puede sonarles a Avatar (la serie animada, no la película de J. Cameron), sin embargo las similitudes que muchos hacen son escasas. En este mundo la magia esta al borde de la extinción y se la asocia con brujería, de modo que se envían soldado a acabar con todo rastro de ella. Inmerso en este contexto es donde aparece el personaje que accidentalmente se ve imbuido por la fuerza extraña de un fragmento de meteorito caído en las proximidades de la aldea. Al volver a tu pueblo lo encuentras devastado y los soldados han secuestrado a toda tu gente, para peor no tardas mucho en ser capturado y arder en la hoguera… lejos de ser el final, comienza tu verdadera aventura.

Lamentablemente [b]Wildfire[/b] no es un juego libre de bugs. Uno de los mas importantes que encontré ocurre en dos misiones concretas donde el objetivo se completa al ser capturado por el enemigo. En estas misiones, si mueres se da la misión como completada. Incluso si mueres a los pocos segundos de comenzar el nivel. Incluso te da todos los premios por terminarla sin matar a nadie, ser sigiloso y finalizar en tiempo record.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002252866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 526, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1624813919}
review:
[H1]パズル要素強めのステルスプラットフォーマー [/H1]

謎の軍勢に村を焼かれた主人公が、偶然手にした火のエレメントの力を借りて、仲間を助けていくという話。

それだけ？
実はそうでもないのだが、あえてミスリードしてまで隠しているのだから秘密。

ゲームとしてはステルス要素アリの2Dプラットフォーマーで、「村人を助ける」などのお題をこなしつつ、各面の出口を目指すという流れ。

ただし直接攻撃力がない人なので、基本的には敵に見つかったらアウト。
相手が諦めるまで逃げるか隠れるしかない。
そこを多彩なエレメントスキルや環境オブジェクトの活用、ルート工作で乗り切るというパズル要素が強く、特に序盤は手を止めて考えさせられる面が多い。

ちなみに主人公が駆使するのはエレメントを作り出す能力ではなく操る能力なので、周囲に火種がないとスキルを発動できないという縛りも良い。
「吊り橋に火を放って、敵の見張りと一緒に谷底に落ちてもらう」、「頭上から障害物を落っことす」、「スキルを放って敵を陽動し、その隙に先に行く」などのコンボが、上手く決まったときはなかなかの快感だ。

タイトルにもなっている鬼火スキルで草木や木造建築物に火が付くと、連鎖的に延焼していくため、ちょっとした火種が画面を覆うほどの炎熱地獄になるのもなかなかに面白い演出であった。

後半は育ったスキルでゴリ押しが効くようになり、ゲーム性が変化する印象を受けるが、最後まで楽しめた。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971918665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 986, 'last_played': 1623878620}
review:
Wildfire is a delightful stealth platformer that sees you controlling a loan villager that stumbles upon a fragment of a magical meteorite which grants you the power the control the elements. Filled with plenty of quick-thinking moments as well as making you stop and think strategically, it definitely strikes value for money boasting approximately 10-16 hours of gameplay for the first playthrough and longer if you're interested in completing all of the achievements, optional objectives or completing the levels within the speedrun timeframes.

Would definitely recommend as something slightly different to play solo but cannot speak about the co-op experience as I have not tested it at this point in time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985101150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1623867827}
review:
Story und Gameplay überlasse ich jedem Spieler selbst... aber die Musik und Geräusche sind top!

Sound: 10/10
Muss hier einfach mal die Entwickler loben für diese präzisen Effekt-Wiedergaben.
Einfach entspannt zu hören, wie die Wachen an einem vorbeilaufen. Wenn man im Gras sich versteckt.

Sollte es eine Fortsetzung oder DLC's geplant werden,
dann bitte mehr Map-Möglichkeiten. Einige Passagen waren leider zu eintönig wie man da durch kommt.
Nur eine Methode zu haben und dann noch sehr genau zu werfen ist schwer.
Mehr Vielfalt im Spielstil-Spektrum wäre super.

Aber ansonsten eine gutes Pixel-Adventure-Game, wo man eine Element-Palette der Kreativität sehen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003770847', 'num_games_owned': 10222, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1623662875}
review:
[i][url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/noPROblemscommunity]no.PROblems* [/url] presenta...[/i]

[h1]FIRE PURIFIES ⭐⭐⭐[/h1]
✅Un pixel-art y una ambientacion de un gusto tremendos
✅El valor rejugable que tiene
✅Añade puzzle a los juegos de sigilo...

❌...pero acaba sabiendo a poco
❌Poca variedad de escenarios

Ultimamente he caido en la cuenta que el género de infiltración/acción lleva años de capa caida. Splinter Cell hace mas de 8 años que no tiene una entrega (¿Me estas escuchando Guillemot?) Metal Gear no sera lo mismo sin Kojima (y alomejor no vuelve nunca) y todo ha quedado en las manos del calvo numero 47. 

Por eso, cuando sale un título, que aunque sea ligeramente, pretende que te mantengas alejado de  las miradas de los enemigos y acabes con ellos atacandoles desde las alturas… pues apetece.
Este juego, que fue un "exclusivo" de Humble Bundle, acabo en un monthly, con ese apartado grafico y prometiendo unas mecanicas cercanas a los puzzles a traves del manejo de las distintas "materias" (fuego, aire, agua y tierra) permite afrontar lo retos de variadas maneras. Porque a lo largo de sus mas de 30 niveles, es capaz de ser variado, y mezclar todas las mecánicas, primero explicándolas por separado, para mas adelante mezclarlas todas a la vez en un solo nivel.
3  aclaraciones sobre lo anterior, es que primeramente, el juego no es capaz de mantener el mismo nivel de originalidad a lo largo de las misiones; siendo especialmente flojas las fases finales. Otros niveles, te hacen interractuar con unos bots que debes salvar, y la inteligencia artificial es desastrosa, por decirlo de manera suave. Pero lo mas importante es hacer uso del modo "+new game plus", y aprovechar todas esas mejoras que has ido consiguiendo a la vez que has progresado en tu aventura; cambia el juego por completo el tener acceso a determinados poderes, y con ellos completar los retos que tienen todos los niveles.

Seguro que muchos "speedrunners" que estan deseando apuntar el juego en su lista de los "concluidos" del año, se han perdido el juego de verdad, ese q hace que te replantees los niveles, y sepas perdonarle su "simpleza" inicial.

Merece la pena, por mecanicas, por historia, por gráficos y efectos sonoros. No es una obra maestra, pero entretiene y es un lanzamiento "redondo".

review:
Very good at what it does, which is providing a very systems heavy immersive sim stealth lite platformer. There were a few tiny issues here and there, mostly in regards to giving too few elemental upgrade points, but on the whole a great experience. Especially with the primary stealth gameplay in most games with it shifted towards basic line of sight with distractions, this level of deep systems with complex AI behavior was very enjoyable.

I will be revisiting this in the future for sure, if for nothing else than to mess around with the AI some more.

4/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197980771676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 553, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1622572460}
review:
[h1]♫ Wild thing... you make my heart sing... you make everything burny ♫[/h1]

"Klein, aber oho!" fällt mir zu dieser wunderschönen Jump'n'Run-Stealth-Perle im Retrogewand ein und hat mich dezent in Erinnerungen an das geniale "Gunpoint" schwelgen lassen. Da wird zwar auch geschlichen, aber Gunpoint spielt in der Moderne - Wildfire im Mittelalter. Trotzdem konnte ich auch hier das Spiel nicht weglegen bis ich nicht den Großteil der interessanten Trophies eingesammelt hab. Ich habe das Spiel gleich glatte 2x durchgespielt - und hatte sowohl solo als auch im COOP mit meiner Freundin und einem Kumpel einen Heidenspaß!

In Wildfire spielen wir einen Dorfbewohner, der optisch stark an einen Waldläufer-Magier erinnert. Gleich im Prolog erleben wir einen Überfall des kirchlichen Ordens, der die Kraft eines herabgestürzten Meteoriten für sich beanspruchen will. Dieser ist nahe unseres Dorfes eingeschlagen (, weshalb es gleich mit dran glauben muss) - doch wir waren zuerst an der Quelle - und sind fortan mit magischen Fähigkeiten unterwegs und wollen uns an den fiesen Verteuflern und Entführer rächen. Anfangs beschränken sich unsere Fähigkeiten allerdings noch auf "Feuerbeschwörung", aber das wird sich im Laufe des Spiels ändern.

Der Name ist Programm: Wildfire "simuliert" hervorragend hübsch wie sich Feuer über bestimmte Quellen ausbreiten kann: Gibt's ein größeres Gebüsch und wir zünden den ersten Teil davon an, wandert das Feuer sukzessive über den gesamten Bestand, brennt richtig krass bildschirmgewaltig und lichterloh vor sich hin - erstreckt sich auch weiter über angrenzende Kletterranken und erhitzt freilich auch die Körper der Menschen, die darin stehen BIS sie dann letztendlich auch Feuer fangen. Das passiert nicht sofort, was die ganze Sache noch interessanter macht.

Aber es gibt auch Levels, die es umgedreht angehen: Alles ist eisig kalt und wir könnten instant-sterben, wenn wir uns nicht gelegentlich an einem schnuckeligen Feuerchen aufwärmen - und uns quasi von einem Feuer zum nächsten rätseln / geschickt vorarbeiten. Denn "Wildfire" ist eine kleine bunte Sandbox mit vielen sehr pfiffigen Ansätzen:

- Unser Held kann NICHT aktiv kämpfen. Beschworenes Feuer steckt nicht einfach direkt Leute in den Brand und jeder aktive Kampf wird meistens mit dem Leben bezahlt. Feinde sind nur unbemerkt überspringbar - ansonsten folgt der Tod schnell und erbarmungslos
- Die Umgebung kann zu unserem Vorteil manipuliert werden: Können wir zunächst nur Feuer beschwören, beherrschen wir später auch Wasser und Erde. Wasser kann Luftblasen erzeugen und uns in unerreichbare Höhen schweben lassen oder als Eis Gegner und Oberflächen einfrieren  bzw. sogar neue Wege erschaffen. Oder wir nutzen Erde, um Kletterranken zu erzeugen oder gar zu verketten, um ungeahnte Höhen zu erreichen - oder Gegner einzuwickeln
- Schleichen (und bestehlen) sowie Flucht bei Lebensgefahr ist oberste Pflicht - mit Erde können wir sogar neue Gebüsche zum Verstecken erschaffen
- Mithilfe einer der Kräfte (Feuer, Wasser, Erde) können wir Gebetsschalen füllen und somit in einem übersichtlichen, aber genialen Skilltree neue Fähigkeiten in den jeweiligen Erdzaubern freischalten
- Wer Levels leise, ohne zu töten, schnell, ohne neu zu laden, mit vielen geretteten Dorfbewohnern abschließt, erhält neutrale Magiepunkte, die es auch noch einzusetzen gilt
- Jeder Level hat ein anderes Setup und einzigartige Zusatzaufgaben: Mal müssen wir einen Streit anhören, mal dürfen wir kein Wasser berühren oder niemals Feuer einsetzen. Mal geht es durch verschneite Landschaften. Mal durch eine Höhle mit kampflustigen Luchsen
- Jeder Level birgt einen Meteoritensplitter, der neue einzigartige aktive und passive Fähigkeiten mit sich bringt - allerdings dürfen wir nur 3 gleichzeitig ausrüsten
- Der COOP macht richtig viel Spaß!

Mit all den elementaren Möglichkeiten und der Tatsache den Feinden "Angst" machen zu können, indem man Magie nutzt, die sie bekanntlich noch als Hexenwerk abgetan hatten, ist einfach klasse. Gerade, wenn sie schreiend davon rennen und womöglich über eine Klippe versehentlich in den Tod stürzen. Da braucht's auch nicht krass viele Gegner: Schwertkämpfer, Bogenschütze, starker Rittersmann und Luchse sind das komplette Repertoire. Aber sie funktionieren für sich und besonders in Kombi sehr schön. Alles in allem kann ich diese Perle nur jedem empfehlen, der auf kreatives Sandbox Jump'n'Stealth steht. Sehr geil!

review:
[h1]흔한 킬링타임용 플랫포머 게임[/h1]

젤다의 전설 야숨에서 보여준 각 원소별 특성을 활용한 단순하면서도 당연한 퍼즐 기믹을 2D 플랫포머로 해석했는데 이게 신선해 보이기만하고 퍼즐은 해결 했을 때 야숨과 같이 머리가 띵해지면서 짜릿한 맛이 없다. 2D가 3D에 비해 상대적으로 표현할 수 있는 영역이 좁아 생기는 문제 겠지만 이걸 떠나서도 그냥 어디서 본듯한 레벨디자인이라 요즘 같이 할거 많고 컨텐츠가 상향 평준화된 시대에 매력을 느끼기 힘든 게임이다. 

일단 매력이 없다 뿐이지 게임 구성 자체는 평타는 하는 게임이고 더구나 한국어도 지원해주니 플랫포머 게임을 많이 접해보지 않은 분들에게는 한번쯤 찍먹해보는 걸 추천한다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025468901', 'num_games_owned': 2460, 'num_reviews': 532, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1621792891}
review:
From a low-skill player's perspective - Poorly designed.

Through gameplay ,the game 'promises" certain things - being able to pickpocket keys and other meaningful stuff.
Welcome to the stealth game of "pickpocket every kickstarter's dog tags" - you have no idea if it's worthwhile or not to try and pickpocket someone because you don't know if it has a key or someone's kickstarter name in their pocket.

Sometimes you need keys to unlock things, sometimes you need to burn those things. Which and when? NO idea!

Game feels very on-rails with an over-use of scripted events. 
All the game's timing is focused on speedrunners.

Having difficulty? Tough, more tools is limited to folks who 'got gud' at platforming.

The developers never had someone new to the gaming concept test the game for them.

Bobcat stuff is tacked on and railroady and infuriating.
Exploding level is designed around speed runners.

Do my power suck fire away from a source, or snag a copy of fire from that source, make up your darned mind game!

And what's more, allow me to restart a level from the 'win' screen when you have a shite timed event.

Finally, if you're going to punish me for reloading, then let me choose when I can save instead of autosaving at the worst FUDGIN moments.

Seriously, don't bother relaoding - just restart. You get penalized for reloading, not for restarting, and reloading pretty much never is from a decent spot.

Bad game, bad experience, I'd probably love it if I was "into' speed running or trying to be 'the best' at platforming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004583189', 'num_games_owned': 3096, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 1528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1528, 'last_played': 1621706126}
review:
野火是一款2D潛行像素類遊戲，遊戲中因為拿到隕石碎片後可以逐步的控制火、水、地元素，利用這些元素完成每關過關條件，遊戲內容中很偏向於解謎，另外不能像某些遊戲奉行的只能沒有活人發現就是一個完美的潛行玩法。

[h1]====簡易攻略====[/h1]

主角獲得隕石碎片後可以有四種屬性可以成長，分別為火、水、地、靈魂屬性，元素屬性必須在每關的雕像手上，投擲出想要成長的屬性，過關後就能加點，靈魂屬性則是每關得過條內容達到就可獲得。

遊戲中主角不能開無雙，只能利用ㄧ些陷阱還有地形或者利用藤蔓把敵人捆住後，再用火燒等方式來殺傷敵人，最推薦使用的是關門殺比較快，或者從高空踩昏敵人後在搬到敵人下不來的地方也比較適合。

每關條件都會有可選目標、未被發現、不殺敵人、不重新讀檔、快速通關、升級雕像、所有村民得救(看關卡)、收集零星碎片等幾種，基本上很難一次完成全部的任務目標，有時候可能需要多重玩幾次才能分開完成所有的條件，因為有時候條件內容會有互相衝突的。

技能點數在第一輪的時候最好把所有的技能都點開，不用特意的一定要把某幾項能力升滿，要把能力全升滿要玩到三輪以上才有可能。

[h1]====全成就====[/h1]

裡面有很多的成就條件寫得不是很清楚，再加上有些真的會不知道如何解的，在指南那邊由於語種問題再加上發布者有些寫得很簡略，有些成就真的要多試幾次才知道怎樣解。

基本上如果過關條件都有達成的話，以及完美收集和過關後繼續繼承下一輪後，只剩下幾種比較有問題來講就好。

Thieves' Highway
關卡城市3：從屋頂通過，在玩第二輪以上在解比較好，需要藤蔓生長長度和投擲距離這兩樣能力，一開始不要進入門，把重甲騎士拉到水邊用泡泡包住他讓他摔死，或者裝上"重踏"自己從3F的平台踩昏他或者自己在水邊用泡泡讓自己飛上高空後踩昏也可以，再來就是慢慢地用兩個藤蔓交互地從牆壁上往上丟爬上去就可以解到了，注意的地方在於有時候藤蔓交互生長的距離太近時，會破壞另一個藤蔓導致消失。

Containment Failure
關卡城市3：直接送死。

Extra Concentrated
序章撿橘子那邊，把橘子往村民砸下去會昏迷後，再把村民往箱子丟就可以解到了。

Now We're Even
這個是要燒關卡城市3，不是城堡，能燒得就全部燒光就是了。

I Meant To Do That
需要丟水元素最後一個技能，身上剩下一滴血後帶著水，從高中會受傷的高度往下跳同時把水球直線往上丟，摔死後水球會砸向自己的屍體復活。

Hanging Wonder
先用水滋養一下草，然後生成泡泡再把那個滋養過的草丟向泡泡內，泡泡到頂部後會生成一個藤蔓。

Their Potential Within
只要在最後一關大公爵那邊開啟雙人模式破關就可以了。

[h1]====結語====[/h1]

整個遊戲過程如果不追求完美的話，大概遊戲時長約3~5小時左右，20小時我剛好破完三輪，除了第一輪有兩個城市關卡沒有達成全條件外，其他兩輪都完成全條件，主要時間都花在解成就那邊，遊戲不能無雙這點老實講有點失望，陷阱過少也是，再加上後續可變化性上，真的有點少，尤其那隻短尾貓才出場兩次，一次可操控一次不可操控。

遊戲中可以兩人同時玩樂，但還是建議兩個人都用手把來玩比較好些，因為用鍵盤操控的時候常常用使用到SHIFT和空白鍵同時按，按下的時候會沒有作用......

整體上來看的話算是可以玩的一個遊戲，但還是建議特價再買比較好些。

review:
It's alright. Setting everything on fire or freezing enemies never will stop being fun. Although the story could use some work as the VIP joke in the beginnig is the last good moment and after that you basically just play levels without much context. 

Main issue is the save system. You can't manually save and autosaves get constantly overwritten, so you might as well restart each time if the autosave was in a bad spot. The checkpoints also just save if you walk past them so if you were running away from enemies that gets saved as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014698888', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1621651057}
review: Wildfire presents a mess of mechanics that really don't work well together. Each level has several mutually exclusive objectives, forcing you to alternate between painfully slow stealth or too-fast-to-react running through masses of enemies. It's as if Wildfire tried to incorporate two entirely distinct goals and instead failed to make either of them fun. The optional objectives add an unnecessary tedium to the game, but once I began to ignore the objectives and just focus on finishing the levels, the levels lost their main source of challenge. It's a lose-lose situation: the objectives aren't good, but neither are the levels without some goal challenging you to play smartly. I like the concept of utilizing elements to manipulate the environment and enemies, but more often than not you find yourself out of reach of any elements at all and are stuck merely waiting for enemies to move. Maybe it would be better in coop, but the core single player game is not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078213433', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1611964075}
review:
Sim, VALE O SEU DINHEIRO!

Eu nunca pensei que me divertiria e riria tanto com um game baseado em stealth ( furtividade ). É um game onde uma ação não pensada tem uma grande chance de te ferrar, mas também desencadeia eventos tão engraçados que às vezes dá aquela vontade de sair na doida só pra ver o que acontece.

Mas não é só galhofa, é um game genial, super bem bolado e cheio de possibilidades de estratégias pra se chegar aos objetivos. O desafio é muito bem equilibrado, então os prêmios por acertar são tão grandes quanto as punições por errar. A pixel art é uma delicinha e a jogabilidade é bem simples a princípio, mas vai se complicando conforme novos poderes vão sendo adquiridos.

É um dos melhores games indies que já tive a felicidade de conhecer. Recomendo demais pra fãs de stealth, comédia e, claro, pixels ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197961038724', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1620789648}
review:
The pixel art has a timeless charm to it.  Other than that I have few good things to say about this game.
The game constantly switches from fast paced puzzle solving to painfully slow stealth sections.  The game also suffers from ludo-narrative dissonance.  The first time you gain the power to control fire is when you're burned to death.  Every time after that burning to death gives you the option of which save state you want to reload.  At several points in my short time with game there is story progression that requires the character to die, a thing that in any other point is a fail state. 

Judging from the Steam achievements, 70ish% have the first power and only 25ish% have the second, I feel i'm not alone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136550363', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1620688359}
review:
Muy buen juego, recomendado.
Mecánicas muy dinámicas, originales y con mucha libertad para experimentar con ellas y resolver los niveles de muchas formas distintas según tu estilo de juego.
Buena progresión y dificultad, puedes pasártelo del tirón sin molestarte demasiado si simplemente te lo quieres pasar o puedes ir a por el 100% de los mapas o incluso el modo speedrun integrado si te gustan los retos. También permite ajustar varios componentes de la dificultad por separado.
No se centra demasiado en la historia, es más bien un trasfondo tirando a lo cómico que está como excusa.
Durante la introducción al menos en mi caso los FPS colapsaban cada vez que saltaba un diálogo, pero en cuanto te dejan libre ya no tiene más problemas de rendimiento.
Muy recomendado si te gustan los juegos de plataformas y sigilo 2D que requieran cierta estrategia y planificación. No es un juego donde se combata. De hecho, te bonifican por no matar enemigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053935010', 'num_games_owned': 1102, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1620517599}
review:
Feels like a mix between Abe's Odyssey and Mark of the Ninja. 

Gameplay wise it's a fun time for sure, you can toy with your enemies with different elements ad environmental hazards.
The game is split into levels with plenty of objectives such as no kills, being undected, beating the level in a set time and other optional objectives. 

A major plus is that the game gives you a lot of choice. If you want to mainly upgrade one element you can, if you don't want to be going after all the skill points and bonuses you don't have to and you can also play the game navigating whichever way you want in most of the levels. 

A solid game both in visuals and audio, just a neat game overall really. 
Thoroughly enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999103262', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1619702673}
review:
El problema de Widfire es un problema de mediocridad.

Cuando vi el tráiler vi un espectacular juego de acción con poderes elementales. Primer fallo. Porque Wildfire es un juego de infiltración donde cada fase es un puzzle. Acción hay tirando a poca. No pasa nada, no soy el mayor fan de los juegos de sigilo, pero Mark of the Ninja lo disfruté mucho (por poner un ejemplo relativamente similar).

Cuando empieza el juego, te dan poderes elementales... pero no siempre. Tienes que estar cerca del fuego para coger fuego. Lo mismo con el agua y la tierra. Es decir, no tienes libertad para usar tus poderes cuando quieras. Por cierto, el fuego te quema muy rápido. Lo cual es curioso, cuando hasta el juego tiene la palabra fuego en su nombre.

Gráficamente es adecuado. Tiene cosas buenas, como el fuego; cosas meh, como la mayor parte de los escenarios; y cosas malas, como la mayoría de los personajes. La música es simpática hasta que empieza a ser cansina, cosa que sucede prontito.

Las fases. No diré que están mal diseñadas, porque las soluciones funcionan bien. Pero tengo una sensación de que no se entienden bien ni la fase ni los objetivos. No es cuestión de que sea difícil o no rescatar a un aldeano, es que cuesta imaginar por dónde hay que sacar a dicho aldeano para rescatarlo.

No me encontré ningún bug, supongo que eso lo habrán arreglado ya.

Lo peor de Wildfire es que me ha resultado aburrido. Vine a este juego queriendo que me gustase y he jugado varias fases aún aburriéndome. Pero llega un punto en que, si no me apetece seguir, no tengo por qué poner más de mi parte. Una pena, la verdad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010373780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1619467390}
review:
친구랑 둘이서 코옵으로 했습니다.(엑박패드 두개로 했음)
싱글은 안해봤습니다. 평가 보실때 참고하시기 바랍니다.

정말 재밌게 했습니다. 퍼즐메인에 플랫포머 조금, 액션 살짝 있는 게임입니다.
게임의 볼륨은 2인 기준 8시간정도 됩니다.

처음에는 적 한명 따돌리기도 힘들었는데 나중가면 암살하면서
올킬하기도 합니다. 처음에 찐따마냥 도망만 치다가 나중에 무쌍할때 정말 재밌었습니다.
게임의 진행은 기본적으로 잠입 형식으로 진행됩니다.
그러다가 나중에 스킬이 해금되면 적들앞에서 엉덩이 흔들며 대놓고 약올리며 플레이하는게 재밌었습니다.

친구랑 했던 로컬협동게임중에서 다섯손가락 안에 꼽을 수 있는 게임입니다
난이도도 적당하며 레벨디자인이 괜찮다고 생각합니다.
이부분은 사람마다 다를 수 있겠지만 초반부에는 너무 쉬워서 조금 싱겁다는 느낌을 받는데
중반부부터 고민하지 않으면 진행이 어려운부분이 있었습니다. 그 고비를 또 넘기니까 적들을 학살하며 올킬하는 재미가 있었네요.
스토리가 훌륭한 게임은 아닙니다. 평범합니다.
자신의 마을을 불태우고 자신을 죽이려했던자들에게 복수하며 기분좋게 엔딩을 봤습니다.

파티게임, 경쟁게임에 지치신분들에게 강력 추천합니다!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155161179', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1619399837}
review:
[h1]On Fire[/h1]
[i](TL;DR at the bottom)[/i]

Let me start off by saying this: [u]if Steam had a middle ground review option, I'd be choosing that.[/u]
I bought Wildfire the day it came out but I hadn't bothered doing a review until now, after I had reinstalled it in a "I don't remember why I uninstalled it at all" moment.
Wildfire is an okay game. It doesn't do anything overly new, which is fine since it doesn't need too. But upon starting to write this review I realised that I was actually more annoyed and frustrated playing through the game than I was enjoying it. I love stealth games - 2d or 3d - and Wildfire, in theory, shouldn't have been an exception. It combines straightforward stealth mechanics with the added ability to control the elements around you, and it has fantastic pixel art and music ontop of all of that.

However I found myself playing this like I was playing the Thief (2014) Reboot, in that I was fed up half way through but I wanted to see it to the end so I could uninstall it for good. [spoiler]Spoiler: I didn't finish it, and I explain why in the next spoiler text.[/spoiler]

One area the game falls a bit short is in the movement, which is somewhat clunky. The walking and sprinting are fine, nothing wrong with them. The jumping feels off as The Witch can't jump very high, but leaping gaps - even small ones - usually feels more like a leap of faith than an accurate movement. Having a crucial movement like this feel like it's basically luck isn't great. 

Another area is that, until you go back and play the the levels again with all the powers - in new game plus or if you're trying to get more spirit points - most levels are fairly linear. Go here, do exactly this to get by, etc... 

This last part is spoiler territory:
[spoiler]I didn't finish the game, and I don't think I will. At the very end of this stealth game that doesn't have combat there's... a boss fight. The Arch Dutchess. This game is in no way suited for a boss fight, and it's very apparent trying to fight her. I get that a lot of time it's the natural conclusion for games; y'know, the good ol final boss. It's, as far as I understand, the standard 3 hit formula. do a thing, hit, repeat for 3 times. However, the player never gets a chance to regain any missing health and there aren't any checkpoints. So if you still only have the three starting hearts and don't have the spirit points to unlock extra hearts? Tough luck.[/spoiler]

TL;DR: Wildfire is okay. I still recommend getting at full price because I truly believe supporting small indie artists is the best thing to do, but definitely do a tiny bit more research before making the final decision to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073571423', 'num_games_owned': 1818, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1618980284}
review:
Have you ever wanted to control the elements to murder, I mean hide from guards that are seeking to kill you? Have you ever wondered what would happen if an enemy wore armor made from very unfortunate materials? Have you ever wanted to watch a bobcat slide and look like a sausage gliding across the screen? THEN WILDFIRE IS THE GAME FOR YOU!!!

I got this game not expecting much from a Humble Bundle a bit ago and when I started it, it was an absolute blast! My friends and I decided to stream it on twitch and it became one of our favorites of the year so far. While it does have its glitches and frustrating moments, we often were just laughing at the choices we made to get in those positions. Often, if I declared, "I have a plan", it would lead to absolutely devastating results! 

The best part of the game was the fact that every puzzle could be solved in a plethora of different ways! Have fire and want to use smoke to hide yourself? Do it! Have water and want to trap your enemies in bubbles and walk passed them? You can do that too! Want to trap the enemies in vines and make them pass out? Yup! This is indeed an option! Want to hide in a bush and let them pass? A bit boring, but yes! 

I found this game to be wildly creative, especially for a small team and as their first game! I highly recommend it to anyone viewing it and can not wait for their next game to come out!

review:
Great variety of stealth and action. Whether you want to scuttle past your foes unseen, using your wiles to distract, spook, and obscure, or set off a chain reaction of explosions leaving charred bodies in your wake, this game has a lot to offer. 

My favorite moment was sneaking into a mansion and pulling water from the bath to crush the guards inside prisons of ice until they passed out, then chucking their unconscious forms from a fourth story window. Big fun.

review: This game has an INCREDIBLY strong beginning and the rest of the game just does not capitalize it. It boasts playing several different ways but halfway through the game in the mountain levels it bottlenecks you down to just one element and implements several mechanics that are just frustrating and annoying to deal with making levels feel tedious and annoying rather than fun and exciting and inventive like the beginning is. The ending boss fight is lackluster resulting in ignoring most of the mechanics you've learned and just giving you a girl who rotates around the screen. I beat her pretty early on and then died from fall damage from a missed jump right when I thought the game was over. It baffles me that this is even possible because they very easily used the stones that you have to touch the ability to heal you earlier in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984348678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1609163319}
review:
A fun and surprisingly robust stealth/action platformer in a colorful fantasy setting, a cool little break from genre convention. It's got Mark of the Ninja vibes, but also reminded me of Oddworld or the SNES Aladdin as your moveset increases. There's a wide range of unlockable abilities that give you plenty of options for solving difficult sections, and a huge number of optional challenges for each level. 

My big piece of advice would be: don't try to be a perfectionist on your first playthrough, because many of those challenges are very frustrating to try and grind out, although each of them adds to your pool of upgrade tokens, so the temptation is always there.

It's not at the top of my list for replayability, personally, but there's a lot of potential for that if it clicks for you. Definitely worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198837517870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1618016451}
review:
I wouldn't recommend this game in the sense that... I wouldn't recommend this game.

It's not bad, per say. It has an interesting premise and interesting mechanics, but the controls are extremely clunky*. And this is a stealth platformer, with things like limited time events, fall damage, skill point reduction for being noticed, etc. Clunky controls do a very good job killing the experience. Throw in an (intended) soft-lock on level three (no permanent fire source) and I've lost interest in playing this game. While it's not terrible, I doubt I will recommend Wildfire to anyone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842034566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1658725547}
review:
I'm only an hour into the game and am already addicted. Wildfire employs a lot of the old platforming and stealth elements in a unique way. Enemies hit hard in this game, so it is best to stay hidden from them. If you jump on them, you take a hit. At the start of the game, you only have 3 hearts, 1 hit costs 1 heart. The game seems to reward stealthy behavior versus aggressive behavior. In most games where I would have the ability to throw fire blasts and such I would want to be as aggressive as possible. Not this game. In this game, the fire you wield is a tool as much as it is a weapon. You can scare enemies away with the fire and sneak away unharmed. The goal is to get from point A to point B on the map, not to simply murder all of the enemies. During my first hour, I only killed one enemy by burning a bush, and it was accidental. I'm trying to focus on the stealth aspects of the game versus combat.
I enjoy the pixel graphics a lot because they add a nice touch to the environment. There is a lot of story and lore in this game that it makes it even more fun to play. The quests a lot of fun, and each map has a side quest, which serves as an added challenge. 
If you enjoy pixel games, side scrollers, and games that challenge you, I recommend WildFire.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984361668', 'num_games_owned': 1381, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1616883940}
review:
Excellent and very fun, I enjoyed the majority of the game overall except a few points where I screwed myself over and couldn't progress and had to restart a level after making it impossible to climb back up somewhere, but that is more of my fault than it is the game's design.  

Complaint about an encounter at the end of the game: [spoiler]I also found the final boss a bit unforgiving with some attacks that knocked me into a corner, dunno if you can block or dodge the lightning bolt but it hit me every time I was too close, even if I jumped or ducked. [/spoiler]

Overall though, very solid game. Controls felt good, interactions with the environment were fun and got chaotic at times. The optional challenges did add a lot more to think about while playing too. 

I do sort of wish the new game+ run started you at a level select instead of redoing everything in order again as I'd love to replay specific levels with all abilities. Maybe I missed this when I was checking it out though.

If you're a fan of repeating levels to try and clear them in different ways or optimising your way through, like in games like Dishonored, then I think you'll enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181740219', 'num_games_owned': 1763, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1616348431}
review:
Gameplay en vidéo 👉 https://youtu.be/oo5MOyzIqhs

J'ai foutu le feu à plein de choses et j'ai adoré ça ! Mouahaha... Vengeaaaaance!
Nan, plus sérieusement, Wildfire est une super bonne surprise. Je l'ai lancé sans trop savoir à quoi m'attendre, et j'ai adoré. Il s'agit d'un jeu d'infiltration en 2D avec une trame narrative : notre village se fait attaquer, tandis que notre héros gagne des pouvoir élémentaires et cherche à sauver les villageois qui se sont fait capturés ou se sont enfuis. On évolue d'un niveau à l'autre avec des objectifs optionnels pour chaque niveau, ce qui augmente la dose de fun. J'ai adoré chercher différents moyen de finir une seule map : brûler des ponts, faire peur aux ennemis, les attirer, puis passer en douce sans se faire apercevoir... et ce n'était que le début du jeu. On a un arbre de talents également, qui fera évoluer le perso dans différentes directions, selon notre désir. Bref, gameplay assez riche et original. Ne parlons pas de la direction artistique - pure merveille !

author: {'steamid': '76561198054087313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1622856811}
review: My friend accidentally left his Humble Bundle subscription on and got the latest humble bundle. He knew he wasn't going to play any of the games, as he already has upwards of a thousand games in his steam library, so he offered me to pick one to gift to me. I chose Wildfire. I figured it was going to be a game that I play once and then let rot in my Steam library until the end of time. Boy was I wrong. This game is a diamond in the rough. The art is masterful, the music is thematic and immersive, and the gameplay is amazing. It's basically if Celeste, one of my absolute favorite games of all time, was a stealth-based puzzle game. The controls and movement aren't quite as razor precise as games like Dead Cells or Celeste, but they are good enough to give you all the tools you need to pull off some USDA-Approved, Grade-A bad-assedry. It also showcases some simple, yet highly effective mechanics relating to stealth, cover systems, making noise, moving hostages, and of course the main focus of the game: the use of fire, water, and other elements to affect the terrain, allowing you to add a whole new level of strategy to how you approach a level. These mechanics seem simple at first, but they quickly evolve and merge together to create a highly technichal, yet intuitive set of mechanics that do not struggle to compliment each other. I've only played for 6 hours, but I already know that this game is going up there with the likes of Journey, Katana Zero, and Dead Cells in terms of quality. Not quite a masterpiece, but certainly worth a mere $15.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023817873', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1617295138}
review:
[b]+ Artstyle: [/b]I like pixelated games and some of the animations are particularly beautiful.
[b]+ Optional quests: [/b]Each level has an optional quest that challenges you to either only use a single type of elemental magic, or explore more of the level, rescue X amount of people, etc. This means that you are forced to take a slightly different approach for each level which is nice. Too bad the levels are so repetitive you'll start to ignore the quest halfway through the game.

[b]- Random unlockables: [/b]You find gems around each level which give you some sort of power up. These are, however, random and some of the seem pointless.
[b]- Not as fun as the trailer suggests: [/b]In the trailer you see the main character wreaking havoc by setting everything on fire and scaring everyone away. This doesn't happen in the game. You can scare enemies, but after a couple of seconds they'll just follow you until you hide somewhere.
[b]- Lacking in tutorials:[/b] Whenever you unlock a new spell (different from the gem stuff) you get a mini level that aims to teach you how to use the spells. These are absolutely useless since they don't show you any real world example. I just ended up not using more than a couple of the spell upgrades because I didn't find a way of reliably using them to get around the level more easily (compared to just making a run for the exit).
[b]- Level variety: [/b]95% of the level layout and main quests are the same.
[b]- Enemy variety: [/b]You have 4-5 enemy types and the last one is introduced pretty late in game, which makes it look like the devs ran out of ideas of how to make the endgame challenging enough. I wouldn't mind having so few enemy types if they were at least very different from one another.
[b]- Startup time:[/b]I never thought I'd complain about this, but it takes [i]ages[/i] to start this game. It takes a couple of minutes for the game to start, which is inexcusable.

[b]Rating: 4/10[/b]

The game is pretty, but it's not much fun. The trailer makes it look like you can fool around and set everyone on fire or trap them in cages, but you rarely get to do this in game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1617214655}
review:
Wildfire is one of thousands of 2D retro pixel platformers infesting the Steam marketplace.  In this console ported stealth/action platformer, you run and jump around various platforms and solve a number of "puzzles" using the plethora of gimmicks added to the game, like chicken catching and throwing, burning things and so on. 

PC gamers will immediately be insulted by console peasant children's toy gamepad prompts.  They chose to use obsolete retro pixel "art" as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget or talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result.   Likewise, the obsolete, old, dead retro 2D platformer game design was used instead of more contemporary game design, presumably for the same reasons as the poor quality "art" substitute.

Paradoxically, a lot of work went into loading the game full of gimmicks like elemental magic powers, climbing, swimming, throwing and so on.   If they had perhaps spent all the budget on improving the graphics they wouldn't have had to try so hard putting lipstick on the proverbial pig.  No matter how many accessories and how much makeup you put on Mr Oink, he's still a pig. 

There's no excuse for charging $15 for an old dead console ported platformer game with old dead retro pixel graphics.  The same money would get you games like Frostpunk, Bioshock or Metro: Exodus.  It's just impossible to recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003013967', 'num_games_owned': 7908, 'num_reviews': 955, 'playtime_forever': 1592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1592, 'last_played': 1616442441}
review:
Recommended
[code]A beautiful and excellent stealth game where you play with elements. One of the few games that gets better on the second playthrough. [/code]
[hr][/hr][b][h1]📕Intro Recap: [/h1][/b][hr][/hr]
When two villagers return to the village after hunting for the very important poultry (VIP), they discover that a meteor has crashed nearby. One villager (you) and his loyal dog decide to investigate. Upon reaching the crash site, the villager touches a shard and gets infused with magical powers that turns you into what people call a "witch". 

Since the authority doesn’t want witches to run around freely, they send in captain Caira to raze the village to the ground, round up all the villagers and burn you at the stake. The weak part of their plain is that your powers seem to be connected to the elements, so while you're burning, the fire power kicks in and you're ready for some payback.

[hr][/hr][b][h1]🎮Gameplay: [/h1][/b][hr][/hr] 
Well, not really. Although the intro sounds like you're going to go crazy on the pitiful soldiers with your newfound power over fire, the main gameplay mechanic is actually stealth. If you've ever played a stealth game, you know what to expect. Soldiers patrol the set path and you have to jump between bushes while their backs are turned. Running, walking on certain floors or falling from high cliffs generates noise that's marked by a circle. When the enemy soldier hears it, he'll stop patrolling his route for a few seconds and investigate the origin of the sound. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2432350420

They're not very smart and won't think to check the bushes, so you're perfectly safe. The problem happens when they see you. Then they switch to pursuit mode and chase you until you run outside their field of vision or hide in a bush. Using your powers to fight them directly is useless because the elements just bounce off of them and your jump isn't strong enough to go over them. But you can use the powers to distract. 

Fire isn't the only element you get to play with. Spirit, water, and earth powers get unlocked as you progress. By the way, I forgot to mention that you can't embrace a power without a source. With the exception of monoliths for fire and unlimited water sources, every other source only allows one use. While water and earth work similar to fire, spirit acts more like a complimentary power where you upgrade stuff like health and how far you can throw the element. You earn spirit points by completing secondary objectives. These challenges include no-kill, undetected, and even speedruns.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2432378934

Upgrading the main three powers works a bit differently: each level has a statue that's holding a bowl. When you throw an element into the bowl, you earn one skill point of that element. Unlocking everything is not possible during the first playthrough, so you'll have to prioritize one full power or run the risk of struggling with three mediocre ones.

Each power has six skills, with the fifth being the only passive one. While increased swimming speed doesn't sound that useful, falling from greater heights without getting stunned is almost a necessity. Elements can be improved further with a shard hidden in each level. There are 12 shards for each element and they grant active or passive perks. The bad news is that you can only equip three. 

Levels are mostly linear and force you to play in a certain way. The goal is to reach the exit while saving an occasional villager or just getting past the enemy patrols. Later levels offer a bit more freedom but there's usually one solution that works all the time. Fire is your ultimate power and is used for burning down wooden doors, scaring enemies and rescuing prisoners. 

As I mentioned at the start of this review, enemies can't be fought directly but they can be scared or distracted. Throwing a fire into a bush will cause the enemy to panic, which allows you to walk right past him unnoticed. In worst case, the enemy will jump off a cliff or burn to death. A more peaceful option is to steal keys from soldiers or whistle to distract them. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2432381436

Enemy types are very basic. You have soldiers, archers, shielded enemies that are immune to fire and dogs that can smell you even when hidden. These dogs are the most dangerous adversaries because they will hunt you relentlessly and even climb walls. Getting past them undetected usually involves carrying a sleeping dog that masks your smell or outsmarting them by taking another route. 

Death doesn't matter anyway – unless you're going for the "no restart" challenge. Upon death, you respawn at the start of the level or the last activated stone obelisk. That's perfectly fine, but what I do have a problem with is the unreliable checkpoints that are too far apart and autosave that activates at the worst possible moment, usually right when you lock yourself in a room. 

[hr][/hr][b][h1]🙋‍♂‍Final Thoughts:[/h1][/b][hr][/hr]
I don't know why the game allowed you to control the dog for one short section and then forget all about it. It feels weird to introduce new moves and then never use it again. You have to save the dog in one level, but you don't have any control over it and he just leaves you at the end. Seems like a wasted opportunity. 

After completing the game, a plus mode is unlocked in which you get to keep everything you've collected. This allows you to tackle the levels in a completely new way as you'll start with all the skill points you acquired so far. This is also the only way to upgrade everything and collect every shard out there. One nice addition is the co-op mode that can be a lot of fun or a complete mess when your buddy ruins a seemingly foolproof plan. 

[hr][/hr][b][h1]👍/👎Pros and Cons: [/h1][/b][hr][/hr]
[b]Pros: [/b] [list]
[*] Playing with elements is fun
[*] New game plus opens new ways
[*] Meteor shards
[/list]
[b]Cons: [/b] [list]
[*] Unreliable autosave
[*] Dog is never used
[*] Levels feel too linear
[/list]

[hr][/hr][b][h1]🏆Make or Miss: [/h1][/b][hr][/hr]
Rating: 7/10
Reviewed by:[b] Sosich [/b]
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38888018-United-Critics/] Please follow [b]United Critics[/b] for quality reviews[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047853506', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 301, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1616873179}
review:
Como juego de sigilo es regulero, pues hay que esperar mucho a que se queme un liana, o a que los guardias se muevan de un sitio a otro. Aun así, no está mal del todo cuando tienes todos los poderes básicos y vas un poco a tu rollo. Personalmente no he usado el agua prácticamente nada, pero si que iba colgando lianas por doquier.

El juego tiene muchas habilidades, pero probablemente necesitarías jugar dos o tres veces para desbloquear todas las cosas, que tampoco son un game changer. El apartado gráfico es interesante, sobre todo el fuego cuándo quema cosas y el cómo se extiende, si bien los NPCs son casi todos iguales entre si y las frases se repiten ya en la segunda hora de juego. 

Otro punto negativo a destacar es que si la cagas (y lo harás mucho), solo hay dos opciones. O empiezas tooodo el nivel desde el principio, o desde un guardado automático que hace el juego sin tu saber donde. Los niveles están bien hechos, pero un poco más de dinamismo a la cosa y el tener tu más herramientas diferentes, lo habría ido genial.

En general, creo que el juego está bien a pesar de todos sus fallos, aunque no vayas a el buscando un preciso juego de sigilo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985224184', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1616715588}
review:
Wildfire is a nice looking 2D platforming stealth game, with a great emphasis on elemental effects, which are particularly well done.
It is not a bad game at all, but has some very serious flaws in my opinion. 

First and foremost, the gameplay is static and linear, with absolutely no amount of replayability. There are no choices to make or procedural maps to play.
The developers tried to implement an upgrade system with different kinds of elemental spells to unlock, but it falls flat on its face, as all spells are basically either a jump-more spell or a stun-a-target-for-a-few-seconds variant with different graphical effects.

The combat is non-existant, as you can't defend yourself or kill enemies with your spells, you can only stun or make them panic, hoping they fall on spikes and die. It makes sense for a stealth game, but given the limited amount of agency that the player has on how to approach a level, it gets pretty boring pretty fast. The game has a surprising amount of health regen spells and status that refill your health, but as combat is not the focus and is often a game-over condition per se, all these health mechanics find no actual use in the game.

AI is lackluster, with enemies patroling on predefined paths, looking and eventually chasing for a few seconds if you make particular noises or enter their visual cone. They'll reset as nothing happened when exiting their range. Even throwing spells at them will not bother them in the slightest. They however panic easily and become completely unrealistic as soon as they see some grass burning, but even then, they'll reset to normal and delete what happened in their memory soon afterwards.

The first few levels are particularly interesting, as you have just discovered fire and find some cool ways to use it. The following levels are too linear and repetitive to be particularly enjoyable, and mostly resolve on the same gradients and patterns. You discover some new elements every 5-6 areas, but as noted above, it enables some different level traversing and stun opportunities, but fail to change the flow of the game in any meaningful way.

Overall a good looking game which offer a few enjoyable hours of content. Total play time for a single run is about 10 hours, with no meaningful replayability. Probably better played in co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839528300', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1616562172}
review:
短時間でクリア出来るようなのでサクっと終わらせるつもりが、存外面白くて全ステージのサブクエ、ステルス、不殺、ロードなし、村人救出達成までやりました。
スピードランは面倒なので途中で諦めましたが。

特に実績や条件達成クリアを気にせず普通にクリアするだけなら難易度はかなり低めの面クリ型ステルスアクション。
火、水、地のアビリティを使用して自分なりの方法で攻略していけるので緩めのアクションパズルが好きな人にもおすすめ。
直接攻撃がないのと不殺クリアでアビリティポイントが貰えるので、敵をガンガン殺していきたい人にはあまりおすすめではない。

各ステージにはサブクエ等の条件クリアがあるが、1度に全ての条件を達成する必要はなく何度かに分けて達成してもよい。
例えば初回で不殺とロードなしクリアを達成すれば、再挑戦する時は何度でもロードが出来て敵は殺し放題となる。
ステージは自由に選べるので少し進めてアビリティを強化してから再挑戦も出来ます。

サブクエは少し工夫しないと取れないものもあるが、攻略を見ないと分からないという程難しいものでもない。
スピードランを無視すればじっくり考える時間があり、敵から逃げるのは簡単だしそこまで精密なアクションが要求される事もありません。

色んな攻撃手段があるのに1番便利なのが敵を高所から踏みつけて眠らせるというのはどうなのか。
踏むのが難しい場面も多かったり、踏むのが合わせにくかったりもしますが、眠らせると他の敵が通って起こされるか周りで音を立てない限り目を覚ますことがないので、邪魔にならない場所に運べば楽々進めてしまいます。

review:
Lots of stuff to love and hate. I loved the mechanics, the environmental interactions from using grass, fire, and water is all very satisfying. But I hated the levels, the linear design meant most of the game was spent hiding in bushes while VERY SLOW guards walk past me so that I can slip by. The game, by the way, is much MUCH more fun playing fast and loose. The art and sound is all great, too. You can tell a lot of love went into this.

I ultimately gave up due to the escort missions. Slowly ferrying multiple people through tight areas with lots of guards was just painful.

Overall I did have fun till I stopped having fun, and the level of detail in this game really is great, so I am recommending it to people who don't mind the slow game of hiding in bushes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966134367', 'num_games_owned': 3557, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1616325688}
review:
TL;DR - Play it once, maybe with a friend to ease the pain. Steam still has no neutral rating.

You need to start the game at least three times to get enough upgrade points for everything.

The items that modify your skills are random every time you pick them up, even when you restart the level. If you got something interesting but you screw up and have to go back to a save point before you picked it up, it's now something else until you either pick it up elsewhere or start save-scumming.

If you equip an item that lets you pick up and interact with objects from afar, you're going to find out how terrible the controls are. Not only are you already juggling using the same key (E) for "pick up villager" "drop the fireball and start a fire/go find a new one because you needed it actually" and "pull a lever that three villagers are now crowded on top of" but now you're also stuck on a lever that's about 8 meters away from you, still interactable even though you're standing on a completely different lever. Fun fact: You can softlock yourself inside prison cells with this thing.

The game has a baffling amount of health regen items, ones that modify how your elemental powers can let you get health back. Thing is, none of the mechanics in this game really incentivize combat so most of the time you're going to lose health to jumping off cliffs. Health that jumps back up to full when you touch a checkpoint anyway.

The level design isn't the worst I've seen, but it's the most unimmersive I've seen in a long time. The caves and the like look fine, a cave isn't supposed to look too aesthetic, but when you're in a town or the last castle levels, everything still looks cavernous and asinine. They do not feel like actual constructs people would make, they feel and look like massive caverns made with stone and lumber.

For a stealth game it's just ok.
Not very fun in the long run, every elemental power and their upgrades feel more like "graphically different way to stun an enemy to walk past." If you play through this once it's amusing enough, but I would personally rather replay Monaco for a good stealth game, and Wildfire's controls weren't good enough to be a fun platformer, either.

I almost feel like there was a few random difficulty spikes, but maybe I just specced my character wrong xD it happens! At any rate it's a ton of fun, and something I would be proud to have developed myself! 💯 recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029205285', 'num_games_owned': 1308, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 2358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2356, 'last_played': 1623085347}
review:
I played the demo and that was pretty fun, it kinda sold me on wanting to get the full version ASAP...even though I was already pretty set on wanting to get it since it's initial announcements because of its various innovations with the elemental mechanics.

As much as I enjoyed the demo though, it was a fairly condensed experience designed to give you a small taste of each of the elements that you get to work with throughout the game and only lasts a couple of hours.  At the time of me writing this review, with the full version of the game (which I found heavily discounted ~ what a lovely surprise that was) I'm at just under 40 hours and about to start level 21 (Mountains 6). I'm not sure how many levels there are overall (I could look it up I'm not one to spoil these types of details for myself lol), but when looking at the game map I'm in the upper right section...about to leave the mountains, so I still have quite a bit to go it seems, which is awesome.

I haven't tried co-op yet, but I intend on doing that once I complete the game or if my niece/nephew comes over or if a friend happens to stop by before that milestone is reached. I'm not sure if the game allows multiple concurrent play-throughs at the same time (some games don't allow it, which is odd) but when I start co-op, I'd ideally like to start over from the beginning with whomever I end up playing it with so that they can get the full experience.

In terms of actual gameplay, it's pretty clever in that there's definitely a degree of strategy involved and I love the fact that the levels are open...as opposed to being scripted with "forced" linear solutions. The level objectives and optional goals/achievements encourage multiple plays to try to complete each one in different ways and promotes creativity in the ways you go about doing things. It's a very nice touch that adds to immersion factor tremendously. 

Furthermore, the way the character progression and elemental upgrades work leaves alot of room to customize your guy to suit how you're most comfortable playing...for the most part..but the main idea I've been running with is trying to keep all four "powers" as evenly upgraded as possible, since you definitely make use of everything. How deep you decide to go into the upgrade tree for each "thing" is kind of a product of the progress of the storyline and how you complete each stage (which ultimately determines how many points you get to spend and on what), but at where I am currently I've barely been able to upgrade water and earth much at all, which is another factor that leads me to believe that I still have alot more to go in the game...unless you don't get to upgrade everything to max, which, I'm not entirely sure how I feel about that thought but I suppose I'll see how it goes (lol).

In terms of the powers we get to wield, if you haven't played the demo, we get fire, water, earth and spirit. Then within each of those we get a number of passives/secondaries that we can upgrade and activate. The first three are fairly easy to imagine...various ways of using or controlling the named element. Spirit is the "different" one that kinda compliments the other three in different ways and the character in general. It's a really well thought out upgrade tree though and everything is useful at various points for different reasons. There isn't actually any room to favor or lean on any one skill since you genuinely will need all of them since each "biome" and even the various sections within those will demand a healthy mixture of powers to be able to complete the levels the best way possible (not counting speed runs, which, personally I'm not much of a fan of but there are achievements for that in this game).

Anyways, do I recommend the game? Whole-heartedly and without any doubt. Is it worth full price? I would say yes, which is rare these days for any game. I was fortunate enough to get it at an incredibly deep discount, but their asking price is more than reasonable considering the replayability factor on top of everything else. I'm not sure how the game ends, but this is one that I would definitely love to see made into a series or even get some DLC for if the story leaves room for that possibility. I suppose that's all I'm going to say for now though. Feel free to ask questions if you're curious about something I may not have mentioned, or if you'd like more details about something I did mention but maybe didn't delve into deeply enough. The game is definitely a gem and deserves some awards :)

review: Molto sfizioso, questo Wildfire! Uno stealth in 2D decisamente minimale sotto tutti i punti di vista, ma che vi divertirà, se siete amanti del genere. Infatti, se a tutti salterà all'occhio la minimalità della grafica, voluta e a mio parere comunque in linea con i moderni pixel art, soltanto giocando vi renderete conto di quella dell'IA, davvero poca roba per uno stealth game. La cosa potrebbe far storcere il naso ai puristi, ma anche in questo caso, credo che gli sviluppatori non abbiano voluto calcare troppo la mano stressando il giocatore, sarà comunque presente da spuntare in ogni missione, per i completisti, la casella "Undetected" e non sempre sarà facile, ma la cosa non sarà necessaria. Vi troverete di fronte una trentina di missioni da superare come meglio credete. Potrete scatenare il panico sfruttando i vostri poteri, oppure tentare di completare gli obiettivi principali senza farvi vedere da nessuno, oppure ancora potrete cercare di battere il tempo della Speedrun, l'importante per progredire nella trama saranno gli obiettivi principali, poi chi vorrà potrà cimentarsi anche in quelli che si è lasciato alle spalle...ma senza stress, appunto. La trama è poca roba, nulla di trascendentale e se non capite l'inglese non strappatevi i capelli e giocatelo comunque, che il gioco è divertente e non vi perdereste nulla. Prezzo? Secondo me, tra i 3 e i 7 euro si può fare, personalmente l'ho pagato molto meno e un po' mi sento in colpa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146150437', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 207, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 981, 'last_played': 1683994271}
review:
WOW. This is easily the best stealth game I have ever played. What amazes me is how flexible it is. Most stealth games can be broadly categorized into the save-scummy part where it essentially is a big puzzle you have to remain undetected because once you are spotted you are toast, the other time you have some ability to save yourself but less save ability and the purpose is to think on your feet a lot more. This is whichever one you want. For each mission you have several objectives, a main objective for the mission, a secondary optional unique objective for each mission that often requires you to go quite out of your way for people who enjoy it, as well as standard optional objectives for each mission: undetected, no save reloads, no kills, speedrun target. If you want the save scummy type you go for the undetected and/or no kill ones, if you want a more fluid think on your feet, you go for no save reloads and these will lead to drastically different results. And the stealth design for each mission is just wonderful. I only have 2 real complaints about this game

1. The sound emotes enemies give off on either discovering you or snoring when you are close (if you knock them out) is some of the most ear-shattering sounds I've ever heard and for something that happens regularly (one mission you even have to carry a sleeping enemy across the map) it is inexcusable. You can disable it in settings, but I went basically the entire game before I found that out. Awful.
2. The autosave - I can't understand what's it's based around. It's not time - some missions you can go several MINUTES between it acting, while some that's not the case. It might be invisible trip-lines, but I couldn't make those out. And it also has an EXTREME dendency to save AFTER you've messed up. This isn't a huge concern if you are playing the "think on your feet" playstyle, but if you are doing undetected/no kill and/or especially the optional objectives each mission, you are under a lot more limitations and need to experiment. Some missions do have more actual checkpoints to supplement this, but some do not. It really isn't that good. 

That said, still the best stealth-game I've ever played and I heartily recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009823849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1615561322}
review:
Wildfire is a really solid environmental-driven stealth game, featuring... 

[list]
    [*]A reasonably diverse methods of proceeding through the game.
    [*]Solid level replayability (and a new game plus).
    [*]Advanced gameplay tricks and techniques that you can learn to provide a nice skill curve.
    [*]A set of mechanics which are satisfying and can lead to memorable gameplay moments. Certainly, I remember the time I ran to the finish point of a level, [i]whilst on fire[/i], whilst being chased by a bobcat... which was [i]also on fire[/i].
[/list]

As far as notable limitations go; the story is a little light after the intro - besides some nice writing in some background worldbuilding elements - and whilst the levels get significantly harder there never is much variety in enemies. The enemy AI is also extremely basic/standard for stealth games with no real interesting twists of note. There's also a pretty finite variety of environmental objects to interact with - albeit their introductions are paced out quite well - and there's a very occasional oddity in level design, like one level that features a written note explaining that a character is holding onto a spare key (that could help you complete the level)... but said character doesn't appear to be anywhere in the level, based on what I can see.

All in all, though, Wildfire is an easy recommendation for anyone interested in stealth games, or are simply compelled by environment-driven gameplay opportunities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071153921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1614871386}
review:
[h1] A gorgeous stealth game, I’d be more than happy to recommend to anyone interested in the genre. [/h1]

[b]Pros[/b]
-High quality pixel-art, great attention to detail
-Stealth gameplay is already enjoyable, spells give it a nice twist and are introduced via a tutorial every time you unlock a new one
-Various level types (pure stealth, escort, alternate character, etc.)
-Multiple paths to successfully complete each level
-Offers optional objectives and speedrun challenges from the get-go
-Well paced progression

[b]Cons[/b]
-Input feels slightly off/delayed from time to time
-Comes from the genre itself, but the gameplay is slow, so if that doesn’t float your boat, you won’t enjoy this title
-Story is forgettable (so far)

Wildfire is a beautiful game, the attention to detail is astonishing. Though admittedly, story so far is pretty forgettable, the core gameplay is strong, levels are fun, playing with the elements adds a nice twist to basic stealth gameplay. [u] If you’re in the market for a stealth game, I can whole-heartedly recommend taking a look at this title! [/u]

For more detail on the above points and a look at gameplay, please join me as I elaborate on my thoughts in this video:
[url=https://youtu.be/doiPz_27gYM?t=1729] Click Me [/url].

差评！挂羊头卖狗肉的东西，潜行游戏爱好者千万不要上当。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970761123', 'num_games_owned': 2960, 'num_reviews': 904, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1615989858}
review:
This game is currently in the Humble Bundle for March 2021. If you are interested in the game and it's before April 6th, 2021, consider picking up the game as part of the current monthly bundle.

After an playing an hour to review for the Humble Choice March 2021 Bundle:

So the demo has now become the full game, and I think I like this game even more than the demo.  This is a rather interesting platformer where the main character is a witch and fighting against a bunch of crusaders.  Every level seems to have a small amount of story and it’s well told.

The gameplay mostly seems to revolve around elements, so far I’ve only worked with fire, but lighting the foliage on fire is rather entertaining as is watching the knights run from it.  The last level even had me playing as a bobcat and just slaughtering knights, so I hope to get that ability eventually. 

There’s a lot of replayability as there are multiple goals for each level including a level-specific optional one, and each completed goal gives the player a special skill point.  

Pick this up if you liked the demo in August of 2020 or pick it up if you like what you see.  It’s an interesting platformer with what feels like a lot to offer. And that demo is available on steam as well.

If you enjoyed this review or want to know what I think of other games in the bundle, check out the full review on or subscribe to my youtube channel: https://youtu.be/8FX-MpYshT4

review: Very unique fast paced stealth game. Its gameplay is very simple, intuitive, and rewarding with a lot of potential for optimization. Each level has multiple little objectives to work though and levels are shorter so you don't have to rely on checkpoints as much. You can get the missed objectives on replay so I never stressed about getting the perfect run or managing my safe files. It's impossible to kill enemies without using environmental hazards, which means that every enemy is a threat and you always have to deal with them in some way instead of just killing/incapacitating every single one. I got this through Humble Bundle but I would pay full price for it.

review: I pick up Humble Choice each month for my Twitch Streams. I pick one game for myself and give the rest as prizes for my followers. This month I picked Wildfire because I had recently gotten into 2D platformers and this game is loads of fun. Without giving away any spoilers, the game is a healthy challenge, but never feels harsh or unforgiving. You learn from each mistake you make and leads you to re-examine your approach to the challenge at hand. You think you are getting one kind of game, but you are picking up an entirely different one, and that entirely different one is a joy to discover and tons of fun to learn each new mechanic and explore your newfound powers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031441058', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1615040569}
review:
There's a lot to get used to before enjoying this game. The protagonist's movement is weighty and gravity is strong making platforming feel sluggish but deliberate. The opening chapter of suggests a greater focus on story than is present in the rest of the game which is really just a loosely connected series of stealth challenges rather than a real narrative. And finally it was frustratingly common for the game to miss inputs in the heat of the action leading to unfair losses.

All of that being said, I did enjoy my time with Wildfire. The interactions between the elements grants enormous freedom in how the player can approach any given obstacle. Each level has 5 optional challenges which can be completed together or over the course of multiple play-thoughs of the level. I highly recommend playing each level multiple times to do each of the optional challenges because, for instance, a level that may be trivially easy to complete without ever being spotted may be far more interesting trying to complete within a time limit. I finished my first play-through with 100% completion, though I there are certainly some challenges that were overly frustrating (I have in mind a certain bobcat escort mission which was extremely difficult to complete without killing any enemies).

Overall, if you like stealth games and you like having a lot of freedom in how you approach solutions to problems, I certainly recommend Wildfire.
