author: {'steamid': '76561198083293364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1615128980}
review:
It isn't bad, in fact it has some really fun ideas, but it feels like something is missing. I think they haven't done enough with what they had.

There are only 4 enemy types: soldiers, big soldiers, archers (with bows that shoot like on full auto lmao) and bobcats.

You can't actually hurt anyone directly. Sounds mean and I know this is a stealth game, but when you give me the power to  control the elements I kinda wish for the ability to at least knock people properly out (who are trying to kill me). You can do that, but only in silly ways like freezing somebody twice in a row. Give me penalty for killing people or make it really risky to attack, but don't take the ability to attack away, that just takes so much from the concept of being a freaking witch.

Prisoners are stat points so failing to rescue one is a reason to replay a mission. You can imagine it's frustrating when said prisoner glitches into the ceiling on one of the longest levels. The final boss also glitched into a wall once. Not super bad bugs, but somewhat gamebreaking (if these happen to you that is, might as well be rare).

This game is also hell for completionists,  as each mission has 5+ optional quests like >don't kill< or >be this fast< which would force you to replay each mission at least once and I honestly despise the concept of level ratings (they give you additional stat points). Either I finished a mission or I didn't, who tf cares if a guard saw me, they. forget. me within seconds anyway xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198288563155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 1712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1609425617}
review:
之前玩城镇第一关的时候确实被偷众筹盒和一些附加奖励条件弄得心烦给了差评，实属不公道，现在改好评了

已经全成就了，其实除了那个偷东西的成就有点多余以及憨批以外（有些关卡地图特别大，要仔细去盯巡逻兵身上的闪光，非常费眼神而且特别影响流畅度），这个游戏还是能看出来制作组非常用心的，可以说完成度是非常的高，作为一款潜入类游戏，游戏性特别强而且非常欢乐，如果不把特殊能力升级满直接随着流程挑战所有关卡的附加条件的话，可谓挑战性极强，玩起来特别考验战术，背图，以及反应力和操作，确实是很有意思的游戏，整个玩下来能够感受到制作组的认真态度与丰富创意，另外值得一夸的是该作的翻译，基本上做到了信雅达（碑文翻译得特别好！英文原文也特别优美），良心好作品，好评！

review:
After a nice start with the tutorial levels, the game became a bit frustrating for me due to the lack of options at the beginning. I play at "One-hit kill" difficulty, which also might have had something to do with my frustration (turned off at the last level). However, after making it through, the game was enjoyable. Replayability is good and the unlock system can be challenging but it's usually worth it. I still didn't get all the abilities yet though.

As a stealth fan, I recommend the game, mostly for the various ways of completing a level once you've unlocked most of the abilities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011511045', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 4376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4318, 'last_played': 1637444884}
review:
An all-time great sandbox for making mischief, a must try for anyone who enjoys systems-driven chaos or innovative stealth. If you like wizard crimes, you'll like this game. 

Something that I often struggle with in games that focus heavily on interactive systems (MGS5, Shadow of Mordor, etc.) is that often none of the interesting scenarios ever seem to happen to me. However, that isn't the case here. In Wildfire, the tools you're given are intended to spark the imagination, but they're also impactful enough that even their most straightforward uses can result in spectacular chain reactions. On top of that, the visual language of the game often makes it easy to read what is happening, and why. This becomes more pronounced the more abilities you have, and going back through older levels (or NG+) with new spells feels amazing.

Another thing I appreciate about Wildfire is its very broad definition of "stealth". It isn't about not leaving a trace behind you, it's about [b]not being caught[/b]. Sure, hiding in a bush is one way to avoid being spotted by enemies. But so is setting a bridge on fire, and slipping by while everyone is panicking. So is raising an ice wall, breaking line of sight. So making a confused enemy fly away in a bubble. 

The third thing I would like to highlight is the slew of accessibility options that puts most AAA games to shame. In addition to fully rebindable buttons, Wildfire also offers a colorblind mode, advanced control options such as auto-jumping at ledges, and even a control scheme specifically designed for one-handed play.

The end result is an incredibly rewarding (and often hilarious) chaotic stealth game for all skill levels. Like the recent Hitman games, even failure is fun. I can't recommend Wildfire enough, go pull some wizard pranks on someone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205260996', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1298, 'last_played': 1631944670}
review:
Oyun gerçekten güzel. Gizlilik bakımından bir (bağımsız oyun) olarak bakıldığında gayet yeterli. Ancak oyunun eksik olduğu birkaç nokta var. Birincisi güzel elementsel özellikleri kazanmak için oyunu en az iki kere oynamanız gerekiyor. Ancak oyun gayet güzel olduğundan bu beni çok da rahatsız etmedi hatta üçüncüye tekrar başladım. İkinci eksik olan yön ise elementsel özellikler baya az ve birbirini tekrar ediyor. Oyunda üç element var ve hepsinde düşmanları hapsetme yeteneği bulunuyor. Yani üçüne de ayrı ayrı koymak yerine başka şeyler katılabilirmiş ya da en azından fazla özellik eklenebilirmiş.

SPOİLER

Oyun sonu boss'u da oyunun başındaki meteora dokunmuş ve onda da hava elementi özelliği var. Oyunun sonunda onu yenip gücünü soğuruyoruz. Dilerdim ki oyunu bitirdikten sonra hava elementini kullanma yeteneğini biz de kullanabilsek. Neyse kısmet değilmiş

SPOİLER BİTTİ

Yani kısaca oyun her anlamda gayet yeterli tek dileğim ikincisinin bir an önce ve daha çok çeşitlilikle çıkması

review:
解法いろいろステルスゲー。
ステージに存在する祭壇に各属性を捧げる事で
ポイントを取得して強化する事ができ，
それによってクリア手段が増えたり簡単に突破できるようになる。

各ステージにはサブミッションやスピードランなど
クリア以外の目的があり，達成する事で属性とはまた別の

2周目とかはもっとヤバ感を押し出してくれてもよかった。

一番頼りになったのが魔法的な何かではなく
強化された踏みつけという。
妖術師（物理）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198006537310', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1619496580}
review:
I've been playing Wildfire since beta and it still manages to surprised me with how fantastic it is.

The pace of the game is whatever you want it to be: Want to try to speedrun it? Go for it! Wanna take things slow & stealthy? Go for the ghost. There's no way to play it wrong.

It's rare to find a stealth-focused game that gives the player this much freedom, but Wildfire manages it well. The mission structure makes it a great game for jumping in for a quick mission when you feel like a fun bit of escapism, or to sit down and try to burn your way through a bunch of levels at a time.

Highly recommended

review:
This game is a gem, and I highly recommend it to everyone, but with an important note: early game gameplay is kinda bad

Until you have more abilities, you often will just wait for guards to move to a certain position, slowly. And waiting is not gameplay if you ask me.

I stayed in a game for a while to get all steam cards, and suddenly it started to make sense, it became pretty fun. Then I started a new game+, and with all the abilities I already have, the second run was much greater than the first. Honestly, I think that leveling up is unecessary feature, that holds this game back.

Now I have all the achievements, and getting the most difficult of them was the most fun part (I don't consider myself a hardcore player, it's just the game being really good with it's harder content).

TL;DR: it really shines in the late game, if you are willing to get through the beginning.

review: This is exactly my kind of game! I have a prefered playstyle in sneaky games that wildifre facilitates exactly like i want it. I like the process of planning and taking it slow, an really explore levels and how to best be undetected.A lot of stealth games put timers on you, and while i understand that they want to drive the player forwards it can also scare away players like me who dont want to be stressed while theyre putting every single enemy on the map to sleep, just for the satisfaction of being able to run around without worrying.I love that! and i also love that all the tasks for levels can be achieved on their own and not all at once, it gave me the courage to try the speedrunning goals because i had nothing to "lose" having already completed every other goal in my own way. I've got to new game plus and im gonna keep playing till ive maxed out and cleared every challenge!I really recommend this for sneaky people,  fast or slow : )

author: {'steamid': '76561198052125808', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1600096148}
review:
Wildfire ist ein Puzzleplatformer mit Stealth-Elementen, bei dem ich mir erst nicht sicher war, ob ich es empfehlen kann, aber nach reichlicher Überlegung kriegt es doch den Daumen rauf. Es ist ein guter Titel mit Problemen, wobei keins so grenzwertig ist, dass man dem Spiel nicht zumindest eine Chance geben kann.

Der Plot ist nichts Besonderes: Böses Imperium Soundso sucht nach MacGuffin Diesunddas, stolpert zufällig über den richtigen Ort, brennt Dorf nieder, auf geht's. Im Verlaufe des Spiels sieht der Obermacker davon ab, den Protagonisten einfach abzustechen und verleiht ihm dadurch immer mehr Superkräfte. Erst werden wir verbrannt und meistern dadurch das Feuer, dann sollen wir ertränkt werden und meistern das Wasser. Spätestens da hätte es bei der Schranze klingeln müssen, denn was passiert, als sie uns verbuddelt, ist eigentlich abzusehen. Dadurch wirkt der Bösewicht nie wirklich bedrohlich, sondern inkompetent. Diese Inkompetenz scheint sie an ihre Soldatinnen weiterzugeben, denn die sind alle nicht besonders helle, was mich zum Gameplay bringt.

Im Herzen ist Wildfire ein Platformer und frischt das Gehüpfe durch die Superkräfte auf, mit denen wir die Umgebung manipulieren und eigene Lösungswege suchen können. So steht es uns frei, ob wir eine Brücke niederbrennen, darunter hindurch schwimmen oder gleich in einer Blase über die Köpfe unserer Feinde hinweg schweben. Später gibt es noch die Möglichkeit, das hohe Gras, das wir zum verstecken nutzen, in Ranken zu verwandeln, um schwer zugängliche Gebiete begehbar zu machen. Dafür opfern wir wichtige Verstecke, also mag diese Entscheidung gut durchdacht sein, denn hier kommen die Stealthelemente ins Spiel. Gegner sehen uns oder sie sehen uns nicht. Tief geht das nicht. Schauen sie uns an, füllt sich ein Balken, ist der voll, gehts los. Wir können uns im Gras verstecken, das komplette Immunität gegen die Sichtradien der Gegner bietet, wir können uns unter oder über ihnen aufhalten, alles gelockerter Genrestandart. Es ist möglich, Feinde mit einem Pfiff in eine gewünschte Richtung zu lotsen. Die Puzzleelemente bestehen darin, wie wir unsere Umgebung manipulieren, um an den Wachen vorbeizukommen. 

Mir gefällt dieses Spiel mit dem Gelände sehr gut. Es ist möglich, ungesehen durch die Levels zu gelangen - ich kann aber auch ein Großfeuer vom Zaun brechen und mich diebisch über die Unruhe in den Gegnerreihen freuen. So kann ich Patrouillen mit gelegten Feuern von ihrem Pfad abbringen oder sogar so sehr erschrecken, dass sie von einer Klippe springen. Leider sind die Ressourcen, die wir für dafür brauchen, arg beschränkt. Lagerfeuer erlöschen, nachdem wir uns einen Feuerball daraus geformt haben. Auch das hohe Gras, das wir für die Erdmagie brauchen, kann nur umplatziert werden. Es kann auch passieren, dass die ganze Scheiße niederbrennt, wenn mein Feuer außer Kontrolle gerät - dann stehen mir weder Verstecke noch Grasbüschel zum umformen zur Verfügung. Hier hätte ich mir ein wenig mehr gewünscht, um aus der Spielmechanik alles rauszuholen, aber das hätte die ganze Sache dann ein wenig zu schwer gemacht, denn ...

Wildfire ist nicht unbedingt einfach. In vielen Stufen wird es vorkommen, dass neu geladen werden muss, da man sich in eine Sackgasse gespielt hat. Das offenbart dann ein nerviges Problem: Das Speichersystem ist Rotz. Ich verstehe nicht, wann das Spiel automatisch speichert und manuelles Speicherpunkte gibt es nicht. So ist es mir mehrfach passiert, dass der letzte Rückzugspunkt direkt vor der Nase einer Wache war und ich beim Neustart sofort entdeckt wurde, weswegen ein kompletter Neuanfang notwendig war. Es gibt zwar Checkpoints im Spiel, aber ob da verlässlich gespeichert wird, kann ich nicht sagen. Es ist schrecklich lästig, wenn der letzte Speicherpunkt zu weit zurückliegt, da man oft recht lange Strecken zurücklegt und es ärgerlich ist, weit zurückgesetzt zu werden.

Was mir ziemlich gut gefallen hat, waren die zusätzlichen Missionsziele, an die die Achievements gekoppelt sind. Manche davon passieren automatisch, andere machen das Level deutlich schwerer. So müssen Errungenschaften funktionieren. Dafür gibt es einen Pluspunkt! Leider bin ich dabei über einen Bug gestolpert: In einer Mission muss ich einen Feuerdämon lotsen, um ein Zielobjekt zu entzünden. Das hat nicht funktioniert - sobald der Dämon mich entdeckt hat, fror er auf der Stelle fest und spulte seine Laufanimation ab, ohne etwas zu unternehmen. Schade!

Das wärs erstmal mit dem grundlegenden Gameplay. Jetzt komme ich zu meinen subjektiven Kritikpunkten:

1. Das Gekreische nervt.

Die komplette Armee besteht aus Frauen und das bedeutet: Sobald ein Feuer angeht, wird gekreischt. Wenn sie erschrecken, wird gekreischt. Wenn sie mich entdecken, wird irgendwie gegrummelkreischt. Nach einer Weile ging mir das auf den Zeiger. Die Soundkulisse ist schon recht minimal - da müssen die im Vordergrund stehenden Geräusche nicht so unfassbar nervtötend sein.

2. Wir sind alle so divers - aber nur in eine Richtung.

Guck mal an wie politisch korrekt wir sind. Ein böses Imperium, das eine Hexe mit einem geschlechtsneutralem Pronomen anspricht, hat meiner Meinung nach zu viel Zeit. Sie sagen "The Witch", womit sie sich eindeutig auf die magischen Kräfte des Protagonisten beziehen, also ist da eindeutig von einer Frau die Rede. Man könnte ja sagen, dass wir das Gesicht der Figur nicht sehen und sie nicht sprechen hören, was auch so ist, aber das trifft nicht auf die Figuren in der Welt zu. Die stehen Nase an Nase mit ihr und müssten es eigentlich besser wissen. Ein androgynes Figurendesign reicht mir da nicht aus. So politisch korrekt kann man doch nicht sein, dass einem so was wichtig ist. Die Hexe sprengt den ganzen Haufen, also ist das wohl eins der kleinsten Probleme, die die zu dieser Zeit haben könnten.

"Sie hat das Lager angezündet! All unsere Kameradinnen verbrennen gerade! Holt Wasser!"
"Warte, warte, warte. Hast du gerade das Geschlecht dieses Wesens festgelegt?"
"Margaret, ernsthaft! Das Feuer hat das Zelt deiner Schwester erreicht - ich kann sie schreien hören!"
"Und ich hole jetzt die Kommandantin. Du warst doch letzte Woche erst beim Sensitivitätstraining. Müssen wir das alles nochmal durchgehen?"
"Oh nein! Da ist sie und sie hat wieder dieses Ding dabei! Duckt euch!"
"Ich ducke mich nicht, bis du nicht die richtige Bezeichnung ..."
[b][u][i]BOOM[/i][/u][/b]
Klappe zu, Affe tot. Gut gemacht!

Alle Männer in dem Spiel werden als Idioten dargestellt. Sie sind feige, fett und werden grundsätzlich nur als Geisel benutzt. "You go, girl" könnte man an dieser Stelle sagen, wenn man den Weiberhaufen, der das böse Imperium sein soll, nicht als komplett inkompetent darstellen würde. Die erschrecken beim kleinsten Geräusch oder wenn ein Busch brennt, rennen mit rudernden Armen durch die Gegend und kriegen nichts auf die Reihe. Die Kommandantin trifft nur doofe Entscheidungen und die gefährlichsten Gegner im Spiel sind bisher die Rotluchse gewesen. Aber so ist das halt, wenn es einer Militärdiktatur wichtiger ist, das richtige Personalpronomen zu benutzen - da hat man für so einen Unsinn wie Training keine Zeit.

3. Das Spiel enthält viele kleine Fehler

Wenn ich lade, scheint der Speicher nicht komplett geleert zu werden, denn manchmal brennen noch Dinge aus meinem Vorlauf oder Wachen sind alarmiert. Es ist auch vorgekommen, dass mein Charakter plötzlich in der Luft stehen geblieben und ganz langsam aus dem Bild gerutscht ist. Auf der Landkarte hat mein Controller plötzlich nicht mehr funktioniert und ich musste erst in ein anderes Menü wechseln, um ihn wieder benutzen zu können. Das sind alles ärgerliche Dinge, aber bisher kein Gamebreaker.

Ich mag Wildfire - das Spiel macht Spaß und die Levels sind schön knackig, wenn ich mich auf die Herausforderungen einlasse. Meine Meckerpunkte (bis auf Punkt 3) sind alle subjektiv und betreffen nur mich, also kreide ich die dem Spiel nicht an. Einen Blick ist es auf jeden Fall wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561198205002249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1475, 'last_played': 1652631183}
review:
One of the best stealth games I played that allows for a variety of gameplay approaches. 
Hide around the environment and sneak past guards, or put them all to sleep and freely walk around like you own the place.
And if all goes wrong - set fire to everything and do what you need to do while everyone is running around in panic.

Pros:
Good controls
Interesting gameplay
Good music
Adjustable difficulty

Cons: 
None

author: {'steamid': '76561198313667807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1598632588}
review: Superbement bien ficelé et plaisant à découvrir, Wildfire va vous faire incarner un sorcier (oui oui masculin en FR, ou alors une witch, féminin en EN) sans nom (donc libre à vous de l'appeler Aang si vous voulez, pourquoi ? lisez plus loin) capable d'agir sur l'environnement en manipulant les énergies du Feu, de l'Eau et de la Terre afin de réussir chaque stages de ce platformer dont la difficulté peut être changée en plein cours de mission. Libre à vous d'être as Easy as a Baby ou de la jouer Hardcore Bro pour réussir tous les challenges qui vous attendent. Graphismes rétros à la Metroidvania, musiques agréables, contrôles facile à prendre en main son seul bémol serait peut-être un manque de mode pvp entre 2-4 joueurs  à se défier avec toutes les techniques du personnage. Bref, c'est un succès. A acheter sans rabais. Et sans sarcasme ajouté ce jeu ne prône absolument pas le féminisme (aka GIRL POWA) !

review: I really enjoy this game!  It's my first stealth-type game, and it's captivating.  It's just challenging enough that I have to work hard to progress, but not so challenging that I get stuck and want to give up.  I love the sound effects, music, graphics, concept - all of it!  It sometimes slows down on my laptop, but I bought this laptop for grad school and never expected to be playing games on it, and it's not really powerful enough for the job.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316430948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1232, 'last_played': 1603975961}
review:
推荐（不强烈推荐），这个游戏其实是很好玩的（有小小的机制性问题不过无伤大雅），作为一款潜行解谜游戏难度适中，能很好的填补碎片时间，个别关卡（洞穴5内里陵墓）速通成就会把你头搞晕，想要全成就至少3周目，每一周目都有不同体验（二周目开始灵魂点数会清空,三周目才会继承），我现在在进行第三周目的游玩（一周目大概玩了玩，二周目除了一个速通全收集）三周目开头所有技能（除灵魂技能）全满级，有些陨石技能真的强的离谱（也有2b技能），这时候欺负这些笨比小兵的感觉真的爽翻，这大概就是翻身做主人的感觉了吧。
顺便,如果作者团队能看到的话，求求了，让洞穴5的速通时间延长一分半吧，这关速通我卡了4个小时了，我脑壳真的要爆炸了

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198011681173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2360, 'last_played': 1596448185}
review:
I have planned to spend most of my summer holiday playing multiplayer games. My internet broke, online gaming failed, my precious break from work ruined. Almost. Luckily I have found Wildfire, which is an original and beautiful stealth platformer, and its charm saved my mood.
You play as a witch who controls the elements. You fight against the soldiers who destroyed your home village. No grand storyline here, just saving your folk and confronting the evil. But this game really doesn't need more.
The levels are build up creatively, allowing you multiple ways to complete it, be it a stealthy or an agressive approach. Better and upgraded abilities even give you so far unreachable alternative ways. You have to use your environment cleverly. Every level has a main objective and also secondary ones. Only the main is required to do, but the completed secondaries also give you points to upgrade your abilities. Usually you need to play a level more than one time, if you choose to complete every objective. These are for example: do not fall into water; remain unseen; rescue every prisoner; do it under a certain time (most of the time quite reasonable limit); do not use a save, etc.
You cannot reach the peak of your powers in one playthrough, but there is new game+, which allows you to retain your collected ability points and upgrade yourself even more. While the new game+ is the same as your first playthrough (apart from the fun you receive that you have use of powerful abilities right from the start, making it quicker and easier to do the levels), you can make it harder for yourself if you want, just turn on "advanced patrols" in the options menu, so the soldiers will be patrolling greater areas.
And of course there is coop, sadly not online, only hotseat, 1 controller+1 keyboard needed.
Best indie game of 2020.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986022825', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1593035175}
review:
I want to add my two cents to this game. Streamed the entire thing in some friends and strangers, and I had a pretty dang good time with it.

Wildfire is a semi-linear platformer with RPG elements -  it reminds a lot of Avatar TLA/LoK simply because the elements are obeying my (inept) commands. It's got a lot of heart in its narrative, but also a black streak of humor a mile long. Nobody has lived until they terrified a guard into running off a cliff because they tossed a skeleton at them from the cover of darkness, let just say.

The narrative is light, but I do want to thank the dev(s) for understanding and using the singular 'they' for the protagonist. I generally avoid playing dudes in video games, so refusing to gender the MC was actually a big help to my enjoyment. Also, THANK YOU for never feeling the need to explain why most (or all?) the guards are big women. It was just the way it was, and a very nice change of pace simply because it's completely different than 99.99% of games I've played. 

The only thing that held the game back for me was that its a bit buggy. Nothing like softlocking or save-breaking, but things get kinda weird if you reload a checkpoint a bunch of times in quick succession (that's more likely to happen than one may think - sometimes probing a situation for solutions is the path to capital F Fun). We're talking more like things like guards spawning partially into terrain, or something being on fire that shouldn't be. Nothing big, and sometimes it leads to funny moments. There's been a patch since I played through, so its likely more stable than it was. 

For anyone hoping for a rich 30+ hour experience: this isn't the game for that. I probably beat this game in close to 10 hours, and came away satisfied. I don't believe in the price/playtime ratio, personally, but I think the price point is more than fair for how much I enjoyed it.  It has some laughs, a couple frustrations, but a simple and fun experience that doesn't overstay its welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151395732', 'num_games_owned': 3946, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1600732141}
review:
for context, I am not remotely into stealth in games ordinarily. in fact, I wasn't sure if I'd have a good time with this when I picked it up. well, I have to say after give or take ~1 hour and 40 minutes of gameplay, that it's thoroughly won me over.

+ terrific pixel art and animations. lush environments that are a joy to explore.
+ nice music, sorta reminds me of Wargroove's OST in places.
+ toes a fine line in letting you feel powerful yet vulnerable; sure you can burn your enemies alive, but you probably won't be able to kill all of them so easily before they catch you and mow you down in kind.
+ the stealth feels fair and like it'd be a great time to try mastering the timing, enemy placement, etc..
+ surprisingly funny.
+ hand-crafted levels that are incredibly tightly designed and rewarding to figure out.
+ it's equally fun, though, to screw everything up and be forced to run through levels cackling, jumping across chasms--as you're laughing victoriously at the enemy soldiers left in your dust--before going le splat.
+ fun platforming and magical abilities.
+ nice writing, especially with the occasional poem scattered throughout.
+ has lots of optional secondary objectives (which completionists will dig) and generally robust gameplay changes you can choose in the options menu. so you can really tailor your experience however you want to. your play style is all up to you, what you focus on is up to you, whether you play by yourself or with a partner is up to ((assuming neither is at gunpoint) the both of) you, how the game functions is up to you. it's great that the game affords you so many freedoms with it on a fundamental level.

this game feels like a fully-formed package thus far, so hopefully it doesn't peter out in that regard. I'd definitely recommend it if it sounds up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981240711', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1594695375}
review:
The game is right on the cusp of being good.

Movement is just a little clunky, dropping from ledges just inconsistent enough to be annoying. Villager AI is bad enough to be frustrating, one will follow while the others can't seem to path around an ice block or down a drop into grass. Unlocking abilities and meteorite shards have enough delay on them before you can do anything is enough to become agitating- especially because picking up a shard doesn't autosave for some reason.

None of these things independently are real deal-breakers, but adding them all up equals a game I can't really recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042186048', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1590541531}
review:
Wildfire is an immersive-sim stealth game that is played on a 2D plane. It is no less deep for it, and if you've ever played Mark of the Ninja, you have some awareness of how this perspective allows for certain gameplay experiences that are unique to it. 

As a Witch/Sorcerer of a sort who can Embrace the elements, calling an orb of them to your palm for application to various tasks, you're hunted by people who would very much appreciate it if you and your heathen existence would cease at your earliest possible convenience. 

To get past these enemies, you will have to be truly cunning. Aye, this is a game for people who love to think and be clever, because there is no traditional method at your disposal to kill or neutralize these foes. There are ways to inflict harm upon them, but each of these is done through understanding of the magic dancing through your fingertips, and perceptive use of your surroundings. 

One thing you'll notice from the get-go is that Wildfire is brilliant at tutorialization. I'm a guide-maker for various games on YouTube, most notably the Assassin's Creed series, but for other stealth-action games as well. At no point did I ever feel the need to 'fill the gaps' in Wildfire's internal documentation because it teaches itself to the player so wonderfully. This is fantastic, because Wildfire is not an easy game. Oh sure, it starts off simple, and escalates from there, but there were definitely moments in which, as a veteran of the genre, I got smacked around and annihilated with extreme prejudice. 

Some of it comes from the challenging level-layouts, which are all masterfully put-together, and some of it comes from... Um. Physics. Yeah. Wildfire is as much Far Cry 2 as it is The Last Airbender. Sometimes, it just won't be your day. You'll do one simple thing on this side of the level, and suddenly find yourself inside a Rube Goldberg machine you never asked to be part of, where you are the marble and the end is your fiery demise. 

But you learn. You learn, and you grow, and you understand, and at the end of THAT journey is a kind of satisfaction that only a game as sure of itself as Wildfire can grant a player. It can be frustrating at times. But if you have the patience for any of what I've just described, and you're willing to try, and try, and try, definitely check this game out. I think you'll enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285402639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1592243623}
review:
前两章很赞，关卡设计也很有意思，对熟练使用能力的要求很高。卫兵不能直接被击杀也鼓励玩家潜行，或者巧妙利用地形杀。第三章加入土元素以后平衡就崩了，两捆草丛就能随便爬上最高的悬崖。而且草丛捆绑+火无脑杀人，对挑战没兴趣的直接一路无双。第四章进了城更是糟糕，卫兵多道具少，杀人过关很简单但是不杀人过关很麻烦。关卡同质化也严重起来，卫兵只有那几种，来来回回都看腻了。监狱关更是无聊至极，同样的构造左右对称一下，大多数时间全浪费在走路上。最终战完全没有使用元素的感觉，只是拿球扔人，结局也和整体剧情脱节严重，或许城市地图就不适合加入这种游戏。[spoiler] 另外第二章结尾的火恶魔关卡明明挺有意思，后面就完全没有其他类型生物了，只有傻傻的卫兵[/spoiler]

建议：土元素捆绑不能被点燃，并且削弱冰元素，不然给我一池子水，我能冻住所有人

review:
Enemy variety is nonexistent, the "stealth" gets in the way of elemental powers you can use. It tries to emulate dishonored like killing is bad for some reason, meaning if you kill an enemy, you miss an upgrade. But funnily enough it's not like any of your skills can kill, or are strong enough to kill an enemy directly.

The game crashed three times in my six hour of playing, and slows down your PC as if the game was a next gen title meant for consoles.

I wish the stealth was a side thing, and you could have a power fantasy with the abilities. It's definitely not the type of game that mixes stealth and op abilities well.

review:
갓겜 그 자체
초반에는 불 옮겨서 나무 태워서 불 공급받고 하느라 꽤나 어려운데
물이랑 풀까지 익히기 시작하면 다양한 선택지로 잠입, 암살을 할 수 있어서 재미있습니다

스테이지 목표를 모두 완료하려고 노력하지 않아도 됩니다
주 목표만 완료하면 클리어는 가능합니다
목표는 하나씩 해도 됩니다. 
주민 구출의 경우 3명이 있다면 각각 1번씩 구출 (총 3번 플레이해서 모두 구출) 하면 모두 구출하기가 완료됩니다

저는 스피드런까지 모두 하려고 했는데 회차 플레이를 지원하는 바람에 2회차로 넘어가버렸네요
2회차로 가면 스킬포인트가 계승됩니다

그리고 튜토리얼에서 알려주지 않는 숨겨진 요소들이 있습니다

목재 구속구는 불을 던지면 바로 풀리지만 높은 곳에서 뛰어내려서 밟아도 풀립니다
물가에 있는 구속구는 물로 방울을 만들어서 방울에 사람이 닿으면 딸려 올라가느라 풀립니다

적들을 기절시켜야 할 때 연막탄, 덩쿨 함정, 얼리기의 방법 외에도 
높은 곳에서 밟으면 1방이고 낮은 곳에서 밟으면 4번 정도 밟아야 합니다
위에 메달리거나 올라갈 발판이 있으면 거기서 떨어지면서 밟고, 다시 올라가서 밟고 
빠르게 4번 5번 하면 적 하나 기절시킬 수 있습니다

마지막 스테이지 전 전 맵이 카이라 저택이란 곳인데
클리어하면 다음 맵인 감옥 탑에서 유리하게 시작하고
죽으면 (죽어도 클리어됨) 다음 맵에서 불리하게 시작하네요
와 매우 갓겜;;

방금 2회차 버그를 하나 발견했는데
스토리 1회차를 모두 끝마치면 새 게임+라고 스킬포인트를 가진 채로 새 게임을 시작하는데
컷씬 두개 스킵하고 남자와의 첫 대화 이후 동물을 찾으러 갈 때 타이틀로 나가기 선택 후 새 게임 다시 하면 
3개 원소의 스킬포인트가 각각 1씩 올라있습니다
근데 영혼 포인트가 사라지고 새 기술 배울때 튜토리얼에서 불이 안 켜지네요
화염 점프를 못 하고 있음 ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ
아니 이런 버그를 안고치고 뭐하냐!

---------------------수정------------------------------

원래 영혼포인트도 환급해주는데 버그 사용시 영혼포인트는 0이 됩니다
다만 튜토리얼 이후 첫 번째 스테이지를 진행할 때 아무것도 업그레이드 하지 않고 진행해야합니다

author: {'steamid': '76561197970406584', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1593176720}
review:
Wildfire is one of those games that doesn't have any respect for your time.

Now, the good parts of the game: sound, graphics and concept are all on point, they make the game feel good in the early levels when it's well-designed.

The bad parts...

Firstly, you've got some pseudo-RPG mechanics that are incredibly unsatisfying. Do you enjoy perfecting several missions so you can get an 0.1% range boost on your ability to throw things?! Like, instead of giving me 25 goddamn ranks of that, give me a couple of ranks of a meaningful effect. Not to mention how many abilities I essentially never used.

Secondly, it's a game with limited resources(except for water, that's the only one you have an infinite supply of if any is around), janky targeting(sometimes even the targeting predicters will lie or there's only a single pixel that actually works), wonky enemy behavior(sometimes they turn around and 360 noscope you when they spot you, other times they jump backwards, startled, yeeting themselves off a cliff. Once you disrupt an enemy's patrol pattern they often get stuck in the new area they end up in, sometimes painting you into a corner. I've also yet to figure out what consistently wakes and does not wake the sleeping patrol cats) and a bunch of other ways in which a mission can get... usually not incompleteable, but suddenly a lot more annoying to complete.

And yet the game punishes you for reloading back to a checkpoint, rather than resetting the mission entirely. 

It's not much of an issue in the early game, but in the late game some of the missions can take a good while to finish. So withholding 10% of an 0.1% range increase behind my not using one of the features in the game. One of the features the developers chose to have in the game. Feels like dickhead design.

Aside from that there are also a couple of missions that are just poorly designed, often in the sense that they use mechanics that are encountered nowhere else without giving you any pointers how they work. Looking at you, chalice mission, with no indicator that lighting the chalices on fire would change anything.

Like... I feel like 90% of my annoyance with the game would disappear if your magic resources respawned, because I really do not feel like redoing ten minutes of gameplay just because the game decided to delete the object I was holding or I missed a pixel-perfect throw despite the throw-predictor saying it was on point. Or one of my escorts decided to yeet himself into a pit or needed leading back and forth several times until he realized he could, in fact, climb up a knee-high ledge.

The remainder would be making the AI(both escort and enemy) more consistent in its behavior and reactions, or if there's a consistency to some of these things I missed in five hours of play, signpost them more clearly. 

The game also suffers a bit from having mechanics that show up in two or three levels and then never again as anything important or relevant.

Long story short, save your money, don't get Wildfire unless it's on a really good sale, but at the same time keep an eye out for the devs' next project, because if they actually try, I'm convinced they can make something much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961230622', 'num_games_owned': 1720, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1590566677}
review:
I hadn't heard of this, but saw it described as a mix of Mark of the Ninja (which I love) and bending from Avatar (which I love) so seemed like a no brainer, but... I don't really understand the comparisons. It is a stealth game like MotN, and it has elemental stuff in it, but unlike Mark, the levels and rules are not tightly designed and easy to read and act on. A ton of the games' systems conflict with each other, there's randomness to the "puzzles", there's tons of times you have to reset pretty far back to get a redo, and maybe it gets better farther in but based on what other people have said about it mirroring my experience, it doesn't improve in the slightest.

Another distinction between this an MotN is in Mark of the Ninja, when things go sideways, you often have ways to react (or a quick retry checkpoint). Here, when things go sideways, usually it's just over because the game is much more a hard stealth game than "action stealth platforming" or whatever you would describe MotN as.

This is a situation I honestly wouldn't expecting tweaks down the road to fix either - these seem like core, fundamental design conflicts that just don't play well together. I've refunded the game and while the premise is super appealing, it just isn't what it sounded like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095048075', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1593285298}
review:
Wildfire is a 2D stealth and elemental magic hybrid with beautiful pixel art backdrops and an elemental system that allows for creative problem solving. The stealth system is pretty familiar for fans of the genre, but the elemental effects steal the show and mesh well with both stealth and chaotic styles of finishing levels. The elements facilitate several different methods of traversal, enemy disruption, and distraction, and the element advancement system lets the player double down on their preferred style or try something new.

There are a ton of unique and weird interactions between the various elements and the enemies that I mostly found when I blew cover and had to scramble to finish the level (for a cool example, try throwing a fireball into a water bubble). In these instances, Wildfire breaks from the genre by being just as fun when the stealth breaks down. Overall, play Wildfire if you like insanely beautiful pixel art backdrops, have dreams of being an ATLA element bender, or if you want something different from the stealth genre (and for less than $20). If you're still not convinced, I did a chaotic LP of this on my YT channel by the same username.

author: {'steamid': '76561198240862168', 'num_games_owned': 3722, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 834, 'last_played': 1592670864}
review:
[h1]🎤Introduction[/h1]
[b]Wildfire[/b] is a 2D stealth game that allows you to embrace elements to your advantage, as a concept the game had a lot of potential. However, I didn’t feel like [b]Wildfire[/b] brought anything new to the table, it’s riddled with a handful of bugs, lacks creative level design and enemy variety. Even though the elements were fun to use, it doesn’t make up for the shortcomings that this game has.

[h1]✔️Pros[/h1]
• Each element has its own unique abilities to upgrade
• Fun stealth mechanics by utilising elements, but doesn’t add anything new to the genre
• Maps are designed to give you more freedom once you’ve unlocked all the elements
• Can equip meteor shards that modify your character and elements in a number of ways

[h1]❌Cons[/h1]
• More boring linear levels rather than interesting ones
• Enemy variety is severely lacking
• Introduces you to play as a different character, but then never uses them again afterward
• Final boss is boring and extremely easy
• To obtain the better elemental abilities you’ll need to play the game at least twice
• New game+ is just the same game but with upgrade points carried over, not sure if there was an increase in difficulty or something but it didn’t feel like it.

[h1]❓Bugs[/h1]
• Screenshots can’t be taken
• The game crashed once during my playthrough
• When reverting back to an autosave you might find things catching on fire when it shouldn’t have, guards might stop patroling, grass that you’ve moved won’t be there anymore even though it should be etc.
• A guard was able to detect me through a wall
• There’s a specific part in the game where you can clip into the wall
• If your hanging from a vine and want to go to the directly next to it, the game won’t let you. Instead, you’ll just jump past it.

[h1]🕹Gameplay[/h1]
[h3][b]Stealth[/b][/h3]
Like any stealth game [b]Wildfire[/b] requires you to plan out each move carefully, making careless moves like falling from a great height or running will likely result in getting detected if a guard is nearby. Thankfully, there are a number of ways to distract the guards to get past them, hiding in the grass then whistling to get their attention is the simplest way. However, you’re given elemental powers as you progress through the game (Fire, water and earth) which can be used in a variety of ways.

Setting grass on fire near a guard or throwing fire at a guard will make them panic giving you the opportunity to run past them undetected. Throwing water creates a sound that distracts nearby guards and earth can be used to make new cover and to reach higher areas. To use these elements you need to embrace them from the source, for example, you can embrace earth by taking a grass patch and then throw it further to use as cover.

Each element has its own set of skills that you can unlock and upgrade by throwing the corresponding element into the statues offering bowl during levels. These upgrades are fun to mess around with but require you to spend a few points on the previous abilities before unlocking the next one. If your anything like me then you’ll probably try to get a balance of all the different elements, however, you can only acquire around 30 element points by the end of the game. So to get the last (and best) ability for a specific element you have to spend the majority on that one element. These better abilities definitely aren’t necessary, but it would’ve been nice to be able to test most of them out before completing the game. 

[h3][b]Level Design[/b][/h3]
Most levels are rather linear without much choice on how to approach them, there aren’t many options or paths to choose from as I’d hoped. But going back to earlier levels with all elements does open up the levels more, now you can easily get to a higher platform by embracing earth and spawning a vine to climb up to. It also allows you to complete objectives on these levels a lot easier than before.

You’re encouraged to explore each level as much as possible despite some of them feeling linear. You can find and equip meteor shards that modify your elements and abilities in some way, for example if an enemy sees you doing a fire jump they will panic, you can throw the water element at an enemy’s face and they will be stunned, explosions have a larger radius etc. There is a lot to find and mess around with to see which work best with your setup.

Each level has a set of objectives that aren’t mandatory to complete the level, however completing them will grant you spirit points which allow you to upgrade throwing distance, embrace distance and max health. These objectives are as follows: a speedrun, complete the level without being detected, without killing anyone, without reloading a save and a unique objective depending on what level you’re on. These were a nice addition to the game and gave you a reason to return to earlier levels once you’d obtained all the elements. The speedrun challenge in particular seemed a bit odd for a stealth game, completely throwing away the concept of being slow and patient to instead trying to complete it as fast as possible.

Enemies that you’ll encounter aren’t varied whatsoever, you’ll technically only come across two different enemy types (the third being just a buffed up guard who isn’t afraid of fire). The most common are the usual guards who either have a sword or a bow, and the other are bobcats who can smell your scent. I felt like there needed to be more types of enemies that change the gameplay to make it more interesting. It always felt lacking and although this didn’t hinder my enjoyment with the game I was always wondering when new enemies would be introduced.

The final boss of the game is a major disappointment, to the point where she just felt like a beefed-up guard with elemental powers. I felt like there was a lot of potential for the final boss to by really intense and fun but it turned out to be an extremely simple, easy and boring boss battle that didn’t give me any sort of satisfaction.

One weird aspect of this game that might’ve been interesting was the introduction of your dog. In a single level, you’ll be able to play as him as the game gives you a tutorial on how to control him. However, after this you’ll never play as him again… I’m not sure if this was just forgotten about or this was intentional but it seemed odd how they would introduce a new character to play as and then never use him again.

[h1]🎧Music & Sound[/h1]
The soundtrack was simple, it didn’t necessarily give off a sense of intensity whilst sneaking around guards but it did help set the atmosphere for each level. When you got caught by a guard however the music would change until they couldn’t find you which is nice to have in a game like this.

[h1]🎨Graphics[/h1]
The visuals capture the essence of each area extremely well, with the detailed backgrounds and distinctively different areas that you’ll explore. However, I felt like some more work could’ve been put into lighting and making areas underground darker to set the atmosphere of a stealth game more.

[h1]💭Closing Thoughts[/h1]
Despite having fun with [b]Wildfire[/b] it has a lot of shortcomings that make it hard to recommend. Along with a bunch of bugs that were slightly annoying, I didn’t feel like [b]Wildfire[/b] brought anything new to the table. With a lack of enemy variety that makes the gameplay feel repetitive quickly, a terrible final boss and linear levels unless your dying for a new stealth game to play I wouldn’t recommend getting this.

[i]This product was reviewed using a free key provided by the Developers[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198846432075', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 2340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1097, 'last_played': 1594450266}
review:
プレイ中は多少の不満点もあったはずなのだがクリア時の第一声は「面白かった！」だった。
おそらくはステルスゲームで退屈になってしまう待ちのターンを能動的なプレイに変えるために生まれたのが異能力系ステルスゲーム（勝手に命名）だと思うのだが、このジャンルに新たな良作が誕生したなと思った。
プレイヤーは妖術による炎で敵を脅して追い払うこともできるし、能力が成長すれば蔦でからめとった敵を生きたまま丸焼きにすることだってできる。敵に直接干渉するような能力で攻めることもできれば、そもそも敵と対峙することを避けるような術で華麗に立ち回る事もできるのだ。この手のゲームに重要な気持ち良さがきっちりと押さえられていてプレイしていて気分が良かった。
一部の能力が少々強すぎるきらいはあったが個人的には「妖術師なのにこんなに弱いの？」とストレスになるよりは多少強くても気分よく能力を使わせてくれるこのゲームのデザインは好みにあっていた。ただやや単調なプレイになりがちなのでもう少し工夫があっても良かったかもしれない（矛盾しているがどうしてもここら辺のバランス調整には口出ししたくなってしまうものだ）。
ローカライズに関してはかなり良好。敵キャラ同士のたわいのない会話やユーモアに満ちた貼り紙も本作の重要なポイントなのでしっかりとした翻訳がされているのはうれしい限りだ。
デザインが難しい2Dステルスというジャンルに真っ向から取り組んで成功した作品。地味な画面だと敬遠せずにステルスゲームファン以外もプレイしてほしい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198075755293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1591874196}
review:
Игра антифановая. Терпимо отношусь к геймплею для любителей сидеть в кустах и ползать раком, однако тут я кончился. Старался дать игре еще несколько шансов, но каждый раз у меня сгорало и я дропал через альт+ф4.
По трейлеру рассчитывал на головоломки со стихиями, платформинг и стелс. Все это тут есть, однако стелс во главе угла. В конце каждого уровня за убийство красный крест, за то что тебя заметили красный крест, за то что решил побольше времени провести на локации красный крест. Такое ощущение что разработчик не хочет чтобы я в его игру играл, а хочет чтобы я сидел в кустах и слушал "очень увлекательные" разговоры стражников

author: {'steamid': '76561198127910631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1591661537}
review:
This is a mediocre game. The boss fight highlights everything wrong with this game (yes, a supposed stealth game with a bossfight). You take the boss down by cheesing it's shield away with elements, then you bait it to come down and go close and use a mechanic literally never explained or used in the game (steal her spirit by pressing e). Then you do the same thing thrice. It just isn't interesting in any manner. I spent an hour figuring out what to do to the boss and felt really frustrated. 

So overall, the game doesn't explain things it should and explains in great detail things it doesn't need to explain as much. It doesn't give much variation in how you can interact with elements, other than strictly defined abilities (most of which you won't unlock unless you really put in the effort). It is an okay game but not good.

The unresponsiveness complaint comes from the feature that switching the direction which you're running towards takes a bit of time. It's a feature, not a bug.

I wouldn't buy it for it's current price, maybe for one third of it's current price I'd consider.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025635370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 788, 'last_played': 1591222682}
review:
✔The Good:
-Wide variety of powers offers a lot of creative freedom in problem solving.
-Fun and engaging stealth mechanics with crystal clear conveyance on why something you tried resulted in a success or failure.
-Excellent tutorials.
-Guards are fun to mess with.
-Good game length. Plenty of time to play and doesn't wear out its welcome.
-Pixel graphics are charming, artful, and informative without being cluttered or overdetailed.

❌The Not So Good:
-Platforming controls are kind of clumsy/stiff, particularly around sprinting and ledge interactions. 
-Ledges and certain powers, especially Ice, have some pretty buggy interactions. 
-Some parts of the game just felt undeveloped/incomplete and made me wonder why they were there at all. Having an entire sub-level dedicated to [spoiler]controlling your pet bobcat as it climbs a mountain,[/spoiler] only for it to not come up again for the rest of the game, was extra confusing.
-Skill progression felt kinda forced/inorganic. The level design is such that few of the skills are actually required to complete the game (which is good and def better than the alternative IMO), so having your skills tied to spending points means they're mostly there to give you an excuse to backtrack and retry levels for better scores or just mess around.
-Some particularly large levels had major, major framerate drops at all times.

Overall: Pretty fun stealth game despite the quirks, worth the buy for its price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198444512715', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1591518455}
review:
Wilefire是一款像素风潜入游戏，故事讲的是一个有魔法的陨石落在村子中，恶势力派出人抓走了村民，主角就担负起了拯救大家的任务。故事讲了一个很经典的问题，愚昧和开明，和力量该不该落在普通人身上。
[h1]画面音效[/h1]虽然是像素风，但是上手的时候还是惊喜，画面很精细，游戏配乐真的好评，代入感很强。
[h1]游戏性[/h1]神秘的陨石带来了火、水、土、风等的能力，可以通过吸收陨石获取相应的能力，玩家可以通过获取的能力为自己探索地图提供助力，比如使用火焰能力吓走敌人和使用土的能力为自己制造草丛和藤曼。游戏内大量可以攀爬互动的悬崖，更是有很多的方式通过守卫和讲元素投入神像中。玩家可以选择杀掉所有的守卫，也可以选择完全悄无声息的潜入（潜入是不可能的），同时，每关游戏会生成一个任务，达成任务可以获得更多的碎片点数升级自己的技能（嗯，太难了）。
[h1]游玩体验[/h1]体验超好，刚开始试图用超级玛丽式跳跃躲避敌人，发现不能用，最后老老实实等楼梯或者拐角，最喜欢和守卫猫鼠大战。上面说过，游戏的画风精细和配乐风格很好，确实游玩起来很好，有点童年游戏那味了。
[h1]优点[/h1]1.不错的画风和配乐
      2.多种可以尝试潜入的方式和路径
3.士兵沙雕的对话和吐槽挺有趣
4.很耐玩，不同的技能，可以完全有不同的玩法
[h1]缺点[/h1]1.游戏开局的猫咪居然那么调皮，差评
      2.游戏全星通过难度还是很高的，适合高水平玩家（不适合我）
[h1]购入建议[/h1]十分推荐，可以获取数十小时的快乐体验。
[h1]欢迎关注或加入鉴赏家：蛋蛋荐游团[/h1]
[u]https://store.steampowered.com/curator/35596718/ [/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198378120511', 'num_games_owned': 4191, 'num_reviews': 1117, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1591430876}
review:
[h1]猥琐、猥琐、再猥琐 [/h1]
简而言之，这是款讲述一个战五渣利用已经消失的黑魔法一路过关躲将最终拯救全村人的故事。看似花式过关的机制下，其实只有“怂”才是第一奥义。游戏各个关卡过高的全达成条件可以直接劝退一大波强迫症玩家。但游戏诙谐的剧情演出及逗比的士兵台词却为这款硬核潜行游戏增色不少。   
[h1]反手游“三星过关”的挫败感[/h1]
游戏的大框架其实是采用的类似于手游的地图行进式可重复游玩关卡制，但是在本作中，大部分玩家完全无法有三星过关的快感，游戏设置的完美过关门槛相当高，其中最大的难点应该是“速通”。速通的快感普遍更适用于平台跑酷游戏，如果放在潜行游戏中，速通和潜入便成了一组矛盾。因为想要玩好潜行类游戏，势必相当考验玩家的耐心。哪个时刻可以冲，哪个时刻必须怂必须精确把握，冷静思考几乎是必须的。可以理解制作组为了加强玩家的成就感而设置速通，但是当前版本中速通时间要求的实在有点苛刻，甚至达到令人发指的程度。
第二个难点是“不杀敌人”。与其说是“难点”，不如用“苟点”更适合。游戏的主角虽然能操作三系魔法，但是本身脆如狗，被士兵发现后如果没有合适的地形，等待他的不是逃就是被宰，无双是一辈子不可能无双的。当然主角偶尔还是能抓住时机干掉不少敌人的，但是这唯一的欢愉还要被“不杀敌人”的过关条件所限制，不得不说这主角真是苟到家了，能不能给他做人的尊严？
 [h1]简单不失有趣的技能机制[/h1]
主角的拯救之路整体上是以火为基础，水之元素和土之力在改变地形上也发挥着至关重要的作用。这些构成了主角的主体技能树系统。此外，还有个陨石碎片系统，装备后有着类似被动增益的效果。可以说这些技能机制设置的恰到好处，作为一个潜行游戏，如果技能太复杂，那就会变成横版过关游戏；如若太简单，怕又是会走靠平台跳跃加大难度的路线。当然，《Wildfire》中火还是占据着主导地位，甚至会变换进入游戏的菜单界面。
 [h1]优点：[/h1]
☑过关自由度高，方法多样
☑BGM略带神秘气息，音效出彩
☑剧情诙谐幽默
☑技能树系统优秀

 [h1]缺点：[/h1]
☒整体难度过高，无法完美过关的挫败感强
☒每次改变设置后，切换界面偶有卡顿
☒键盘操作不是很顺畅，建议手柄
☒50元的原价不是很美丽，也没有首周折扣

author: {'steamid': '76561197973092610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1591142108}
review:
The trailers make it seem like a free form procedural particle physics romp. What you will get however is a restrictive game that limits your options with element scarcity or other tricks like the crawl tunnels that will prevent you from ferrying elements into position to plan some real fun. Speaking of, the fun is in short supply as the mostly linear levels will punish exploration and attempts at alternative solutions. Once you've been through enough of the game you'll have unlocked the advanced powers or upgraded your basic ones enough that you'll be able to grow outside of the restraints that held you back on the first playthroughs, but I'd just save your time and money and find a game that lets you have fun without the restrictive first pass. 
If you do buy, you need to light the 5 chalices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000248322', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 3060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3060, 'last_played': 1591300554}
review:
I'll try to be as concise as possible, but I'm a long winded individual so...here goes! 
First of all, I absolutely love this game. The art style, animation, gameplay, replay, and humor is just amazing. This is probably my favorite game this year and I think the first game I've gotten all the achievements on in a long time. It's got it's fair share of flaws, but nothing that completely breaks the enjoyment of the game. 
Pros:
Graphically, the game is beautiful. Big fan of pixel art, the animation is key in pixel art. With very few pixels to represent a character or world, the only thing that separates the generic pixel art and a living world is animation and this game has it. 
Sounds are great and the music is uplifting. Seriously. I'm ready to go on an adventure with this music. The audio pans as enemies patrol around you. It's weird because most games don't do this on a 2d side scroller, but once you get used to it, it adds immersion. 
Story is a tiny bit on the nose, but very enjoyable. The game doesn't give your character focus on their development (presumably, that's your job as the player) which isn't bad because you definitely get the sense of what the village you come from is by conversations with those you rescue and the soldiers that burned it down. 
Gameplay is a delight. Switching between elements is fun and the game has solutions for pretty much any build you focus on. The skill progression is linear, but it adds enough dimension to the game to be excited to unlock a new ability. Which is very much what you should aim for when having a progression system. 
Cons: 
Let me preface this by saying these are all minor complaints and much of the bugs are known and being addressed. A lot of my complaints come from minor bugs or tweaks that I'd like to see.
- When you do a new game +, the game doesn't really warn you all of your objectives and progress gets wiped. Sure that's arguably understandable, but I thought it'd create a separate save or still have all the story unlocked because I've already beaten the game, but it completely wipes everything. I 100% nearly all of the levels and then I picked new game + to have to do it all over again...and again...(more on that) 
- Some objects don't interact the way it's intended. Some sources of fire can't be embraced as it says there's a line of sight issue when there's not. The game says villagers don't follow you off a cliff unless there's a safe landing below, they'll plummet to their death on their own sometimes anyways, and I've had several game crashing bugs, but only in the new game + mode. Very odd. 
- Climbing controls are a bit frustrating at times. Particularly climbing onto and off of things and dropping down from things. Also your abilities meant to trap enemies will hit friendlies first. Meaning if a companion is standing next to you and you're throwing a smoke bomb at an archer, it'll automatically hit your companion first. That makes no sense especially as your aim indicator doesn't indicate it'll hit a friendly. 
- If you're an achievement hunter, (i'm not, but I did it for this one anyways) pickpocketing all the lockets was a great touch to include the names of backers, however, the game doesn't really give you any kind of tracking for this. More painstakingly, my new game + wiped the slate clean on the progress I made. I literally beat the game about 4-5 times over again thinking maybe the lockets are generated on npcs across multiple playthroughs as I've replayed every level repeatedly checking every NPC to find the missing lockets. Finally found them all, I'm pretty sure you can get them all in one playthrough, but a progress meter would be nice.
- While on the subject of multiple playthroughs, one last thing I'd like to see is to not reset your skills on new game + while this could give you the ability to respec points to try other abilities, they don't take too long to earn, but they take ages to allocate as the game pops up with a resounding "You've unlocked (insert ability here)" and you're just mashing away at buttons because you have another literal 100 points to allocate. Also, replaying the tutorials on new game + seems redundant, but again this is being nitpicky because I'm a child and super impatient. 
- Edit: One last thing I forgot. No spoilers, but the last boss fight is VERY VERY VERY easy and simple. You can literally beat it in under a few minutes and I'm not even good at games. I would've like to have seen more strategy behind the climatic ending of the game. 
PS - Why would you give me an adorable bobcat to play as, but only for a level! More bobcats please!
Overall, I love this game. If you've got a passion for indie games, this is hands down the one to check out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198110127019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1591198725}
review:
출시하자마자 사서 해봤는데 잘 만든 게임이네요.

행동 제약이 좀 많아서 답답하긴 했어요. 다른 분 리뷰에는 암살을 해도 무쌍을 해도 된다고 말씀하셨는데 제가 겪어본 바론 무쌍이 힘들지않나 싶습니다.  기절시키면 양반인데 어떤 때는 처음 맞은 자리에서 못일어나고 계속 맞다가 죽은 적도 있어요. 잠입이지 암살도 사실상 쉽지 않고요.

그럼에도 추천하는 것은 완성도 높게 잘 만들어진 게임이기도 하고 저처럼 성격 급하신 분들 말고 느긋하게 즐기시는 분들이라면 더 재미있게 플레이 하실 수 있지 않을까 싶어 추천합니다.

음 그리고 이건 버그리포트이자 팁인데 마지막 보스는 [spoiler]결정타 날릴 때 얼음 쓰지 마세요 얼음이 안녹아서 대공비가 일어서다 풀썩 쓰러지길 반복하고 다음 장면으로 안넘어갑니다..[/spoiler]

review:
I'll need more time to do a proper review of Wildfire, but for fans of Stealth and Emergent gameplay, you get a lot of that here. Wildfire won't take too long to beat first time around (I'd say 6 hours), but with optional bonus objectives on each level, as well as speed run challenges, stealth challenges and no kill challenges for each, there is plenty to keep coming back to.

NewGame+ allows you to start the game again with all of your abilities, and provides so much freedom for testing the limits of the game. Highly Highly recommended.

Edit: Some small bugs that i didn't have problems with have been fixed now. Game is playing better than ever!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989714801', 'num_games_owned': 570, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1628483753}
review:
I normally don't leave Steam reviews, but I'm afraid this game will be glossed over, and that would be a tragedy considering how much love clearly went into this game. Pick it up and I promise you won't be disappointed.

This game is a gem. There is a long list of games this game took inspiration from that you can find on twitter or reddit or other people's reviews. Instead of listing them all here, I'll just post a couple of them from which the inspirations most resonated with me.

Early game playing stealthy because you have not developed your powers yet, and then later being able to ransack through enemies when replaying stages after you've skilled up your magic feels a lot like Dishonored. On new game plus, some of the early levels had me flying over everything without touching the ground while raining down fire, smoke, vines and ice onto enemies like some sort of insane bombing run. It was incredibly fun.

Planning an escape route to evacuate villagers that are mostly helpless (although they have crazy hops) felt a lot like Abe's Odyssey. Well crafted puzzles that slow down the pace of the game in an engaging way, making you think twice about taking routes with enemies you could circumnavigate easily if you were alone.

There are a couple of "trinkets" or "modifiers" (called meteor shards) that break the game. If you find them, I suggest not using them on the first pass through of a level. They should really be balanced. If you're reading this devs, the one that lets you stun enemies by jumping on a hard surface should really only work if you fall from a height higher than a standing jump. Being able to just jump in an enemies face until they fall asleep trivializes a lot of the harder levels.

For the most part though, the customization with the meteor shards is fun and lets you tackle levels in completely different ways depending on your loadout. I wish you could change your meteor shards upon first seeing the level conditions instead of making you wait until you find a checkpoint. You could say this is intentional, but if the user can just quit to level select after seeing the conditions and then change their shards and restart the level, you're not preventing them from pre-selecting shards for a level and they're also forced to take extra unnecessary time wasting steps.

A little buggy, but nothing game breaking.

Overall, solid 9 / 10 from me. Beat the game and new game plus in 2 days over about 15 hours (I really really got drawn into it). 100% villager rescue on first run, but didn't bother to fully 100% the game on new game plus because it didn't remember my previous clear conditions from the first run. While I understand this is done by design to award the players more soul points, I felt like my progress was erased when I clicked new game plus.

Heavily recommended to all, great job devs!

Edit: How could I forget the Avatar the Last Airbender vibes, and definitely some Korra for the ending. Absolutely loved the sense of humor of the game and all the visual and aesthetic choices made. Should have had a paragraph about how beautiful it is, but it's late now :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198863097736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1591156239}
review:
[quote]加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ADZZW]爱の榨汁屋[/url]&关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34815366/]爱の鉴赏家[/url]，用爱品鉴世间作品，用心流淌真情实感。[/quote]

[h1]这是一款让你尽情施展恶作剧才华的2D潜行游戏[/h1]

游戏开始于一个温馨的村庄中。然而，一颗流星的陨落引来了敌人军队的入侵，打破了村子平静的生活。村民们被驱逐，房屋被烧毁，主角被绑上刑架接受火刑。意想不到的是，具有魔法的主角在火焰中觉醒了，开启了自己的“潜行”之旅。

在这款游戏中，玩家回到中世纪时期，用元素力量燃起火焰、冻结水域或是移动土壤种植藤蔓，用智谋操纵环境来打败迷信的敌人。玩家一路穿过茂密的森林、钻过幽深的洞穴、翻过冰封的山头，逃过公爵夫人军队的追捕，拯救被俘受伤的村民。最终成功夺回失去的家园。

基本的玩法，就是通过操纵魔法改变环境，逃过士兵的侦查。（当然也可以用智谋杀死士兵，不过主角自身没有武器进行自保或攻击）不过在操纵火焰的时候，当心自己也被火焰灼烧哦！在路途中，主角一点点重拾水、火、土三种能力，在地图中完成任务，收集相应的元素来升级技能，来完善自身的技能树。（似乎点亮的技能树可以继承到多周目。）


[h1]是做一个优秀的潜行者，还是整蛊士兵，慌忙逃窜？[/h1]
原本看这游戏的截图，以为是类银河战士恶魔城游戏，像死亡细胞这种类型。其实不然，这是一款潜行游戏。（然而不知为何商店的标签里混进了“灵异”，不必担心，没有任何恐怖元素。）

虽然说玩家无法主动攻击敌人，甚至有点脆皮，敌人挥刀砍来就倒，削弱了一些虐杀的快乐。不过放火烧烧草坪，看着敌人脑袋顶上的红色警戒刷的变为灰色的感叹号，耳边传来惊恐的尖叫声；或是吹吹口哨，扰乱敌人的判断，这种整蛊的快感也是无与伦比的。

每一关的任务非常多，当然不需要全部完成，不过为多周目提供了更多可玩性。个人感觉速通的时间要求比较高，速通是速通不了的，只能慢吞吞在草丛里爬这样子。

比较好的设定是，似乎士兵的跑步速度略慢于主角（多次被士兵追击总结出的血泪经验2333），只要跑得够快，敌人就追不上我x 因此玩家也可以放弃潜行的设定，与士兵展开追击大战，毕竟士兵的智商有限，只能在她的巡逻范围内活动。于是有时就可以体验到，玩家与士兵之间隔着一点空当大眼瞪小眼发呆的奇景。当然，使用智慧潜行过关是更推荐的玩法，类似于解密，烧脑又快乐。


[h1]非常推荐：精致烧脑的潜行之旅 [/h1]
优点：
-有简中，只能在标题界面切换
-精致的像素画风，甚至角色从水里跳出时还有外衣滴水的效果
-剧情幽默
-有趣的音效（特别是士兵的尖叫声）与合适的BGM
-魔法多种多样，可以选择各种方式躲避士兵的侦查，自由度高
-每关的可选任务完成都可以获得成就，成就图标非常可爱

缺点：
-偶尔有点掉帧
-似乎略有点按键冲突，比如shift键冲刺和切换中英文冲突，会造成一定的麻烦，不过可以更改按键设置
-仅限本地多人联机，如果有多人在线联机就更好了


价格方面略高，毕竟是刚刚发售，如果不急着玩可以等待一波打折。总之入手不亏，精致耐玩的小游戏！

author: {'steamid': '76561197987274541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1661409038}
review:
Excellent game. Linear story, but you can continue to gain powers after you complete it by starting new game +. Go through the story again, but with all the powers you accumulated the first time, and it's much MUCH easier to do all the goals of each mission, including the speed runs. Don't even bother trying the speed runs until you have specific abilities and meteor shard powers for each particular mission. A VERY fun game!

What is funny and cute about the game is that the protagonist is a witch (female) and all of the bad guys (warriors, archers, and knights) are all female too. It's pretty cute, and very refreshing. Even the big boss is female. (Not really a spoiler because you find out in the first couple of missions). 

What is really weird is that the antagonists refer to themselves using the pronoun "She", but they refer to the protagonist (you) as "They". "They escaped us again!" "Lets find them!". 

Enjoy the game if you like 2D platformers and lots of magic, stealth, and deception gameplay!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968076117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1591541158}
review:
Wildfire ist ein super Spiel.

Der Grund-Preis (Derzeit 14,99 Euro) bzw. das Preis/Leistungs-Verhältnis ist vollends gerechtfertigt. Nach 16 Stunden habe ich es durchgespielt und bin vollends begeistert. 

Man bekommt für den Preis das was man beim Anblick der Shop-Seite vermittelt bekommt.

-Retro-Optik 
-Puzzle-Gameplay
-Handgezeichnete Grafik (Kein zufallsgenerierter Quark)
-Nette Story
-Moderater Schwierigkeitsgrad

Einziger Minuspunkt ist das ... in meinen Augen ... enttäuschende Ende.
Aber das ist Ansichtssache.
Das muss jeder für sich beurteilen. 
Das Spiel an sich jedoch ist toll gemacht und hält bei Laune.

Ich kann das Spiel vollends weiterempfehlen. 
Klarer Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148029292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1625182728}
review:
I recently say a fav streamer of mine play this and within the first 5 minutes I stopped the video to buy the game; I didn't want to spoil anything for myself of what I was seeing. This turned into a great decision and I've been hooked every since. Amazing world building and little gameplay mechanic details are throughout.

The coop is pretty great too, have a couple hours in that. If you're doing Remote Play, one person will likely have to use the controller (this game functions much better on M&KB) but most levels become easier with 2. Unfortunately, when finishing my co-op session with a friend my main save got overwritten (or deleted?)  and now I have to start from scratch solo... which I welcome greatly actually cause I can't get enough of the game. So while artificially longer for me, I know I'll enjoy every second. If you're having any reservations then you've clearly never fantasized about being a ninja Avatar (can even complete the game as a pacifist).

author: {'steamid': '76561198213575296', 'num_games_owned': 1495, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1639248163}
review:
Магия... Как много магии мы встречаем в видеоиграх, но как мало попадается lore, в котором ей обладает всего один персонаж - главный герой. За что он и получает клеймо колдуна. Именно на это поставили "Sneaky Bastards" выйдя на Кикстартер, и не прогадали - собрав в 2 раза больше средств, чем планировали.

В "Wildfire" магия не является оружием, возможность её впитывать используется для работы с окружением, которое может стать смертельным для Ваших врагов. Вы правильно понимаете "куда я клоню", перед Вами - 2D стелс платформер. Игра хоть и предоставляет игроку возможность умерщвлять NPC, но никогда этого не поощряет, склоняя Вас действовать скрытно и избегать прямых конфронтаций.

В игре множество игровых механик, которые позволяют если не проходить отведенные уровни разными способами, то использовать приобретенные как магические, так и механические навыки для облегчения Вашего прохождения. Важно понимать, что геймплей устроен по принципу головоломки - максимально правильное решение одно, но сложность его достижения будет зависеть от прокачки Вашего героя, поэтому имеет смысл проходить каждый уровень с наилучшим результатом. Это значительно облегчит Вашу жизнь.

The Clever Gamer	[/url] [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198059083326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1601243393}
review:
DISCLAIMER: copy provided by developer. Take the below with as much or as little salt as you like. :)

Wildfire takes some of the best design choices from stealth games including Mark of the Ninja, Thief, Stealth Bastard and Abe's Oddysee, and somehow rolls them together. There are some serious challenges to master (not least the speed-runner times in each level!), but I finished my first play-through in several hours or so at my own pace without going for every single upgrade point.

Plenty of replay value with NG+ and a big collection of elemental powers to max out. I loved sneaking my way through a level without getting detected. I loved changing the structure of the world around me with Earth, Fire and Water. And I loved burning it all down (by accident) when I wanted to move things along.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017427618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1590868995}
review:
Довольно неплохой сайд-скроллер экшн про колдунство и манипуляции стихиями, немного с юмором, немного со стихами, с коопом и с неплохой реиграбельностью. Есть немного стелса ("наверное, ветер"/"просто показалось"), леммингов/мудоконов (привет, одиссея Эйба!), прокачка способностей, новая игра +.
Немного проседающий финал с пустынным уровнем и "босс-файтом" не портит впечатление от в целом неплохой игры.

Рекомендую любителям кооп-игр. Проходится целиком в совместном режиме через Remote Play, за время игры был только один вылет в самом начале.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002600160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1611193072}
review:
Let me start of by saying that within the first 3 levels you'll either love it or dismiss it.
If I were to tell u this game is excellent its because it is. If u were to ask me if i'd recommend it then i'd say THIS GAME ISN'T FOR EVERYONE. if your patient and are a fan of thief, stealth inc. and stealthy like games then your in for a treat. your initial ability FIRE is such a versatile tool that messing around with it is such a treat. with the additional abilities in the later portion of the game it becomes a blast experimenting with different routes. and speaking of routes, this is where the game is such a delight. you can approach a level anyway you'd like but are awarded more for being stealthy. Now I'd be lying if i said the game isnt hard. A wrong move can cost you extra achievement points  or even death. thats where "patience" is key in this. But if u can overcome failing multiple times, then the satisfaction of a perfect mission complete is exhilarating! The Music is such a harmonious and upbeat soundtrack that it just nails it. Though the cheesy screems from the characters are cute but not intrusive to the overall game. this is 1 little gem that must not be overlooked for those who can appreciate pixel art and stealth games. 
Now this isnt a perfect game. FAR from it. there are flaws and nitpicks here and there. like there's no notifications of any sort other than  what the main and secondary objectives are in the beginning of the level. or when in the over world map doesn't tell you the secondary objective until u go into the level. Its annoying because there's alot of levels...
But is it worth the difficulty and short comings?   YOU BET YOUR SCALLY WAG TALE IT IS

author: {'steamid': '76561198055023184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1047, 'last_played': 1591527402}
review:
元素の力を利用し、各ステージ毎に設定された目標を達成しながら進めていく2Dステルスゲーム。日本語対応で、翻訳も違和感は全くない。
各ステージでの行動によってポイントを得ることができる。そのポイントは一つ一つの能力を強化するのに使うほか、その元素から派生した新しい力を開放することにも使用できる。
各ステージにはメインの目標の他にサブの目標やステルス・不殺・スピードランなどの目標があり、これらは能力に割り振れるポイントになるほか実績の解除にも関係する。
能力は1周で全て取り切ることはできないが、ポイントを引き継いだニューゲーム＋もあるので、最終的には全ての能力を開放することができる。

プレイキャラが使用できる能力はあくまで周囲にある元素の力を利用するもの、というのがひとつのポイントとなっている。
つまり火の能力であれば、火を利用する力はあるが発火させる能力はないため、周囲に焚き火などの火元が存在しなければその能力を使うことはできない（某アメコミの炎を操る能力を持ったヴィランのようなもの）。
ただし、その能力も単体での殺傷能力はほぼなく、未強化の状態では驚かせるくらいか、いいところ上手く状況を利用して気絶させるくらいが関の山といったところ。まあ頑張れば殺ることもできるが、敢えてやる意味は薄い。
つまるところステルスゲームなので、PVのように大炎上させるような派手な立ち回りを要する場面はほとんどなく、大部分は草むらや物陰に隠れて敵をやり過ごしたり、口笛を吹いて注意を引くなどの慎重な行動をしていることが多い。

序盤は使用できる能力が少ないこともあり地味な印象を受けるが、複数能力を開放してからは自分なりの工夫ができる余地が増えプレイの自由度が大幅に広がる。
ゲーム性に革新的なものがあるわけではないが、丁寧に作られたステージ構成や力の入ったドット絵表現は惹かれるものがあった。

author: {'steamid': '76561198035442694', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1610118528}
review:
Wonderful whether you go for a stealth or a set-everything-alight approach, and you can take a friend along for the ride.

Great mechanics – things can spiral delightfully out of control (with fantastic fire animations) for you and it stays fun, or you feel the elation of a plan going off without a hitch. The devs have done a brilliant job with the fire in this; in most games fires feel like small afterthoughts, in this one it's like Australia's bush fire season. 

Frequently amusing, seldom frustrating, this should be picked up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835810398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1591327955}
review: This game is a fantastic distillation of stealth games and immersive sims into a beautifully detailed 2D platformer.  Similarly to Mark of the Ninja, another excellent 2D stealth game, you use your equipment to sneak, distract, and kill your enemies.  However, in Wildfire your equipment is the environment around you.  The various systems blend together to create a fluid, enjoyable experience throughout.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990540115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1591358585}
review:
Un très bon jeu d'infiltration dans lequel les éléments sont sous votre contrôle... enfin tant que vous faites les bons choix.

Mieux vaut le savoir, le début fait office de tutoriel lent, et rebutera les joueurs qui espéraient de l'action sans limites. 
Après quelques heures cependant, une rencontre mémorable marque un tournant et les pouvoirs offerts aux joueurs se multiplient, ainsi que les obstacles sur la route du joueur. Le potentiel de rejouabilité se révèle être énorme grâce aux combinaisons possibles et les objectifs peuvent chacun être fait indépendamment, offrant une difficulté à la carte. Vais-je atteindre la sortie sans me faire repérer ou vais-je sauver tous les villageois ? Pourquoi pas les deux ?

Maintenant que j'ai atteint la fin, j'ai hâte de faire le New Game + !

author: {'steamid': '76561198120514821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1590327506}
review:
Wildfire stays true to its name. As the player, you’re both figuratively and literally playing with fire. While your elemental abilities are a joy to use, the game is careful not to let you feel all powerful. Your abilities can open up new opportunities for evasion, traversal as well as defeating your enemies, but they can also just as easily cause strife for yourself.

While the narrative hook left a lot to be desired, the mechanical depth that Wildfire brings is unlike anything I’ve seen in recent memory. Its optional objectives provide various ways to both enhance the challenge of the game, as well as adding new twists on older levels to further replayability for those dedicated players looking to master the art of elemental stealth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198279516186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1706964607}
review: 游戏挺好，这个画风和玩法是我喜欢的，操作的手感也不错。游戏流程比较短，如果不追求完美通关，一周目大概6小时就打完了，升级和碎片可以继承，而且每关过关的路线有很多种，所以可以多玩几周目。缺点是重复的教程和剧情不能跳过，重复打一关的时候比较浪费时间。还有就是感觉优化不太好，有些特效，比如水的特效，会导致在低配机器上画面掉帧、卡顿，如果你是双显卡的电脑，游戏的默认显卡是集显，换成独显可能就不卡了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198141832662', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1591067912}
review:
I played this game for 3 hours and had to stop myself just go to go eat food. Ignore the bad reviews for the most part. There are some glitches/bugs in the game I believe (like when I "pick-pocketed" a key off of someone but it kept giving me the prompt to steal the key), but they are so minor compared to how fun this game is to play. Every "level" is different, and keeps me on my toes. Each area that you travel to offers something new, whether it's a new trait you pick up or a new puzzle you have to solve in a different way. Honestly was so hyped to play this and I'm sad I'm streaming it simply because I can't continue playing the story on my own until my next stream date.
Worth all $15 dollars in my book.

author: {'steamid': '76561199061244563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1591534199}
review:
Wildfire is surprisingly accessible for someone with very little knowledge or experience of gaming. I've been able to progress through the levels here slowly but surely. Your success or failure while playing seems to be dependent on your lateral and strategic thinking skills, patience and willingness to embrace death.

The game has a well-paced and interesting story, with an immersive, evocative score and beautiful artwork. I appreciate that the game has plenty of opportunities to sit and enjoy the scenery and music. There are many small, clever details to notice and enjoy. I originally tried playing it because I know the developer and just wanted to support them, but I'll continue playing it because I'm having so much fun with it!
